Mrs. CLAIRE is in charge of the WEND N SO group. Justine, a former member, is no longer with the group. Claire is married with a 3-year-old child who doesn’t yet attend school. She supports two people.

Claire has been selling shoes for three years. She buys her stock at the Grand market, and she sells to men, women and children.

She would like to buy 20 pairs of shoes.  

She will use the profits to bolster her savings. She wants to improve her activity and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Ama is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of provisions

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor  Esteban es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su madre y hermanos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos. 
Don Esteban necesita el préstamo para comprar 1 batería  y un televisor  debido a que la batería que tenia actualmente para recargar sus artículos electrónicos le dejo de funcionar.
Don Esteban en la comunidad donde vive no exite el servicio de energia electrica y es por eso que espera mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la su familia con esta inversión. 
Don Esteban espera seguir  apoyando  a su familia  para que puedan seguir adelante.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Esteban is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. He lives with his mother and siblings in southern Honduras. His business is growing basic grains. 

Esteban needs the loan to buy a battery and a television because the battery that he has now to recharge his electronics stopped working  In the community where Esteban lives there is no electricity service and that is why he hopes to improve his and his family's quality of life a little with this investment.   
 
Esteban hopes to keep supporting his family so that they can keep getting ahead.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  March  of   2013

loans.use: to buy a battery and a television.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 37-year-old divorced lady. 

To support herself, Faten works as a hair stylist from home. She hopes that one day she will be able to open her own beauty salon elsewhere other than inside her home. 

Now Faten is applying for a loan to get new tools for her home business.

loans.use: to get new tools for her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha runs a catering business, which she has done for three years. Most of her customers are from weddings and similar occasions. She faces challenges such as slow business (taking a long time before she gets an occasion to cook for) and also inflation.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she repaid successfully. The current loan is for 70,000 KES and she proposes to use the loan to buy more utensils for her business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils like sufurias [cooking pots] and dishes

loans.name: Ada De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Ada es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos.
Doña Ada con el préstamo espera comprar una planta solar debido a que en la comunidad donde vive no tienen servicio de energía eléctrica y esta inversión le va ayudar mucho para realizar otras actividades por la noche. 
Doña Ada espera mejorar la  calidad  de vida de su familia. Con la  compra  de la planta  solar ya  que  sus  hijos podrán  estudiar tambien en horas de la noche.
Doña Ada en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore un poco y  con esto seguir  apoyando   a  sus hijos para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Ada is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She lives with her husband and 2 children in a community in southern Honduras. Her business is growing basic grains. 

With the loan, Ada hopes to buy a solar plant, because the community where she lives doesn't have electrical service and this investment will help her a lot to do other activities at night. Ada hopes to improve her family's quality of life. With the purchase of the solar plant her children can also study during the evening hours. 

In a few years Ada hopes that her life and financial situation will improve a little and that she can keep helping her children become good people with better life opportunities.   	

Choluteca, Honduras  –  March,  2013

loans.use: to buy a solar plant for her house.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is married and has four children, all of whom graduated from school and are working.  They own a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells firewood which earns her other source of livelihood. With the loan of Kshs 50,000 she intends to buy more dried fish for sale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina de 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa contruida a base de adobe.Desde muy niña estuvo ligada a labores agrícolas gracias a sus padres quienes tenían como principal sustento económico la producción de cacao orgánico , al cumplir la mayoria de edad , heredo un terreno de cultivo y lo destino integramente a la producción de cacao , al divorciarse logro su independencia pero tuvo como mayor dificultad el de contar con capital que le permitiera invertir en la compra de almácigos usados para reemplazar árboles cacaoteros desfasados pero actualmente sus parcelas se hallan en un buen estado productivo el cual la motiva en seguir invirtiendo de manera fluida.Desea a futuro trabajar con el ímpetu que la caracteriza y a través de sus ganancias cumplir el sueño de mejorar su vivienda a base de material noble esperando así mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta agradecida por la oportunidad brindada , a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar  y proceder con la época de cosecha cacaotera .
texts.en:
Paulina, age 55, is the single mother of two children.  She lives with them in an adobe house.  Thanks to her parents, she has been tied to agricultural work ever since she was a girl.   Their main form of financial support was organic cacao production.

Upon reaching adulthood, she inherited a plot of land, which she allocated entirely to the production of cacao.  When she got divorced, she managed to get her independence.  However, her greatest difficulty was having the capital that would allow her to buy seedlings to replace the old cacao trees.

Currently her land is found to be in a good productive state.  This motivates her to continue investing in a fluid manner.  In the future, she wishes to work with the impetus that she is known for and use her profits to fulfill her dream of improving her house by using sturdy material.  This way she is hoping to improve her children’s quality of life.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the opportunity given to her, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.

She now needs to have 3,000 soles to hire workers from the area and to continue with the season for harvesting cacao.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 55 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 41-year-old wife Irma. Levan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the business that Levan has. In particular, he is producing mastic for floors and gets small monthly income which is rarely enough for food. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Levan will purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop in his own commercial space. As the space is in a populous area, Levan hopes he will have a big number of customers and earn good income. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in the same business. He will be adding more grocery stock in the shop to expand it. Another part will be used for providing better living conditions for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Anood

texts.en: Anood is a 19-year-old single lady who has two older brothers. Anood is a fresh student at a governmental university majoring in psychology. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her semester fees to proceed in her education and get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 37-year-old man who has four daughters. after using his previous loan he was able to improve the cafeteria business and from that he started another business selling birds. Ali wants to concentrate on the cafeteria business as it has more potential and more customers. Then he will work slowly on improving the bird sales business. Now Ali is applying for a loan to offer new types of drinks in his cafeteria, and a couple of new types of birds and birdcages.

loans.use: to bring new types of drinks

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a 36-year-old married woman who works in a beauty center. Her husband works in a blacksmith business. They have no kids. Rola is applying for a loan to bring in a few types of cosmetic products to sell at the salon using her connection. She hopes that one day she can open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to bring in a few types of cosmetic products

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Fatmata.  She is at late forties and is from Waterloo. She is divorced with 2 children aged 6 and 9.  She also has four additional dependents at home.

Fatmata runs a cool drinks business where she sells purified water and cool drinks. She has been running this business since 2001. She works 14 hours per day, 7 days per week. Fatmata says that the distance to travel with the drinks from her house to her business place is very difficult

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks and purified water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to open a bar and restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more assorted drinks and purified water.

loans.name: Jonicel

texts.en: Jonicel is a merchant and operates a sari sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her local area. Jonicel is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more customers. In the future, Jonicel hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a fish vendor from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman with five children. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Lorna works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Lorna has hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 51-year-old woman, living with her son and two daughters. To help in supporting the family Alia works from home selling blankets and making yogurt and cheese for sale. She is now applying for a loan to buy more milk to increase her production of dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more milk to make yogurt and cheese to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Samuel is an entrepreneur. He is a tailor by profession. He primarily operates in Ekumfe-Twi (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 40 years. Samuel is married and has 6 children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Samuel wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels of sewing materials, hence allowing him to cater to more of his customers. In the long term, Samuel plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels of sewing materials, hence allowing him to cater to more of his customers.

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en: Fathiya is a 48-year-old mother. She used her previous loan to buy some tools and start dairy production using the milk she gets from her sheep. Now Fathiya is applying for another loan to increase the number of sheep and goats she has to increase her production of dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abiba is an entrepreneur. She is married with three children and her husband is a farmer. Abiba prepares and sells "gari," a traditional Ghanaian snack made from starched powdered cassava. She can be found selling gari at Ekumfe-Twi, near Cape Coast. She also sells sugar. Abiba has been involved in her businesses for four years and uses the profit from her work to help her husband cover the family's general expenses and pay their children's school fees. 

Abiba is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava and sugar to enable her to improve her overall sales. With the profits from her expanded businesses, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells and adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and sugar to improve her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain new equipment for his furniture-making shop

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu appreciated her last Kiva loan which helped boost her business. For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Tabu dreams of establishing a hotel [restaurant] in the future.

With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is now applying for her third loan to constantly increase the quantity of goods she has. She also wants to add some kitchen products to  her inventory using this loan.

loans.use: to bring in more goods.

loans.name: Ribhiyeh

texts.en: Rebhiya is 30 years old. She is married to a private sector employee. Using her previous loan she was able to add selling children's clothes besides blankets sales, which helped in adding some variety to the goods she sells. Now Rebhiya is applying for another youth loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. For over four years, she has operated a business selling clothes from her home and she also sells groceries to earn additional income. Magdaline's customers are her neighbors and passersby. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her major business challenge is seasonality. Magdaline decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Magdaline is requesting a loan to purchase a bale of clothes and a sack of green vegetables including tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes and a sack of green vegetables

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. She is married and has eight children. Currently, Ama works selling "wakye," a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves. She sells her wakye in Ekumfe-Twi near Cape Coast. Ama began her business five years ago and it has grown substantially.  She has identified growing demand from her customers but is unable to meet their needs due to her limited inventory.

Ama is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans to help her to prepare more tasty wakye. With the profits from her expanded business, she wants to buck the trend and ensure that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a rice and beans to help her to prepare more tasty wakye

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is a 39 years old married woman. Her husband is a driver who works as much as he can to be able to provide for their only son. Tahani decided to help her husband, so she started a small business at home selling blankets and bed covers. Living in an area where social connection is important for a living has helped her gain more customers than she first anticipated.  Thus, she is applying for a loan to bring a larger quantity to be able to fulfill the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is married with 4 children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her brother. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for a few months. She has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling beer and soda.  She works from home and sells on a retail basis and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to sell wholesale only and also to start buying charcoal directly from suppliers. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 47 years old and a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

Manal has a small business at home that she wants to expand, selling perfumes and a few brands of cosmetic products. For that reason, she is applying for a loan to bring in new types of cosmetics and more make-up products.

loans.use: to bring in new types of cosmetics

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a 48-year-old illiterate woman, married to a farmer. They have nine sons and daughters; two of them are serving in the military. To help in supporting the family Feryal sells household products at home to friends and neighbors. Now Feryal is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of home products.

loans.use: to increase the quantity  of household products she has

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna is a 37-year-old married woman, a mother to five sons. To help her husband in supporting the family, Muna works at selling women’s bags and in the back-to-school period she adds selling school bags, too. Now Muna is applying for a loan to bring in a larger quantity of different styles of bags from a wholesale market to decrease her expenses.

loans.use: To bring in more bags

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wraps) cloth and handbags. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase 40 pieces of lesos and handbags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of lesos and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

Caren has operated a retail selling business for the past eighteen years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Dzua

texts.en:
Dzua is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He is asking for a loan to buy goods such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents and maize flour and sugar that will help him to invest back into his business. He is grateful for the new support he has received.

loans.use: to buy goods such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents and maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a university student majoring in business administration at one of the private Jordanian universities. She is applying for an educational loan to help her support her education and pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay fees for her next semester

loans.name: Juhainah

texts.en:
Juhainah is a 20-year-old married lady who does not yet have kids. In the meantime, she has decided to concentrate on her studies and is a university student at one of the government universities. Juhainah is studying to become a school teacher. 

Juhainah is requesting a loan to pay registration fees for her upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es una persona  emprendedora y honesta, vive  con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos. 
Don Francisco con el préstamo espera comprar la planta solar porque en la comunidad donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica y con esta inversión espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida al poder realizar muchas más actividades que antes no podía. 
Don  en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore y poder  seguir  apoyando   a  sus hijos y  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Francisco is an enterprising and honest person who lives with his wife and their 4 children in southern Honduras.  His business is making basic grains.

Francisco hopes to use this loan to buy solar energy equipment because in his community where he lives, there aren't any electricity services.  With this investment, he hopes to improve his quality of life a little through being able to do many things that he couldn't do before.

Francisco hopes that in a few years he can improve his life and financial situation and continue to support his children so that they can become good people with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: buy solar energy equipment for his house.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Jackline operates a fruit and vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high competition in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Menwah

texts.en: Menwah is a 52-year-old mother of six sons and daughters. She has a small food store to support her family. Now Menwah is applying for a loan to obtain more food products for the store to have variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to obtain more food products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 26 years old and is a single man. He is from Nyandarua South. For the past year, Samuel has run a cosmetics shop. 

Samuel is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to buy shampoos and conditioners to add to his stock to sell. In the future, he hopes to see his business expand.

loans.use: to buy shampoos and conditioners

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and a widow with six children. She also pays university tuition for two of her siblings. Elizabeth sells charcoal in a rural area to earn income to meet all of her household needs as well as pay tuition. Her main business challenge is the continual fluctuation of the price of charcoal. Elizabeth is a shrewd and business-oriented lady.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy materials to complete construction of rooms in her house. When construction is complete, she will be able to increase her profit to supplement her already-strained income.

loans.use: to buy materials to complete construction of rooms in her house

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a tailor. He is requesting another 40,000 KES loan to purchase cloth, materials, threads, needles, buttons, and zippers. His goal is to expand his existing business. Daniel is grateful for Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials, threads, needles, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Saiat

texts.en:
Saiat is 61 years old. He lives in the village of Chapala, Bolnisi district, with his 56-year-old wife, 33-year-old son and his daughter-in-law. Saiat requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets and the family gets a small monthly income which is not enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Saiat requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Saiat will purchase a mini-bus. He will start driving on a bus-line from Marneuli in the direction of Baku. His new business will bring an additional income to the family and help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus to work on a bus-line

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Apollo has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread, etc. 

To help expand his business, Apollo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize, rice, sugar and soap to sell, and will help Apollo to generate greater profits and pay school fees and basic needs for his family. Apollo hopes that in the future he will be able to become a rich businessman in his town. 

Apollo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apollo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice, sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Houénangnon Abibatou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Houénangnon Abibatou âgée de 34 ans est mariée à un certain Jean Pierre. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Houénangnon Abibatou vend des œufs et des tissus depuis dix huit ans. Houénangnon Abibatou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Houénangnon Abibatou  avec les autres membres de son groupe désirent obtenir un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AFEPEB consists of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Houénangnon Abibatou, seen in the photo with her hand raised. 

Houénangnon Abibatou, age 34, is married to a man named Jean Pierre. They don’t have any children. The couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Houénangnon Abibatou has been selling eggs and fabrics for 18 years. She buys her stock at a market in Bénin. 

To strengthen her activity and better meet customer demand, Houénangnon Abibatou is seeking a 5th loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs and some fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
Justiniana de 46 años de edad , esta casada con Alberto y tiene 4 hijos a quienes dedica el fruto de su esfuerzo.Posee una vivienda propia construida con bloques de adobe con el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.Justiniana trabaja en sus terrenos agrícolas cuya principal producción es la de cacao orgánico y achiote.Su trabajo parte de realizar diariamente tareas agrícolas tales como deshierbo de maleza, deschuponado de árboles, aplicación de abono orgánico, entre otros; todo ello con el objetivo de llegar a la cosecha con una calida óptima.Realiza su labor en pareja contando en ocasiones con el apoyo de sus hijos para labores menores y convocando constantemente a trabajadores del lugar para tareas colectivas.
Su objetivo a largo plazo es la compra de un vehiculo propio para el traslado de sus sacos con los granos listo para su comercialización puesto que el precio para el transporte es algo elevado en su localidad.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con S/.2,500 nuevos soleS para comprar abono orgánico , el cual sera muy util para sus sembrios.
texts.en:
Justiniana is 46 years old, is married to Alberto, and has 4 children, to whom she dedicates all the fruits of her labors.  They have their own house made out of adobe bloques from their own effort and dedication.

Justiniana works in her farmland, which mainly produces cocoa and achiote (a small tree that produces a food dye).  Her work includes performing daily farm duties such as removing weeds, pruning the trees, applying organic fertilizer, etc.  She does all these things with the hope of obtaining a high-quality harvest.

She does her work with the help of her husband and sometimes their children for small tasks.  In addition, they are always using local workers for larger tasks.

Her long-term goals is to buy her own vehicle to deliver her bags containing grain ready to sell, since in her area the price of transportation is quite high.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the opportunity that is being offered to her.  She promises to make her payments on time.

She would like to have 2,500 sols ($975) to buy organic fertilizer, which will be very useful for her fields.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El Joven Víctor es una persona  emprendedora y honesta, vive  con su esposa y sus hermanos y madre  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos. 
Víctor con el préstamo espera comprar una planta solar porque en la comunidad donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica, espera que con la inversión que realice mejore un poco su situación económica y la de su a familia.
Víctor espera que con la compra  de la planta  solar sus hermanos  sigan   estudiando aun más ya que aprovecharan la  hora nocturna.
Víctor en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore y poder  seguir  apoyando   a  sus hermanos y  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Victor is a young and honest entrepreneur and lives with his wife, siblings, and mother in southern Honduras. His business is the production of basic grains.

Victor wants to use the loan to buy a solar apparatus because in the community where he lives there is no electrical service. He is hoping that with the investment he will improve his financial situation a little and that of his family.

Victor is hoping that by buying a solar apparatus his siblings can continue studying even more taking advantage of the evening hours.

Victor hopes that in a few years his life and financial situation improves and  that he will be able to continue helping his siblings so they become good people with better opportunities. 

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2013

loans.use: to buy a solar element for his home so his siblings can study during evening hours

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is 30 years old and is married with one child. He lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past five years, Moris has been working hard to manage his pharmacy where he sells drugs and medicine. 

Moris is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more drugs to sell at his pharmacy. He will use his loan to generate greater profits to improve his family's living standards. In the future, Moris hopes to expand his business and run a wholesale pharmacy shop. 

Moris is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell in his pharmacy

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es: El señor Aner, habita en la comarca llamada Veracruz del Municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa pra tener mejores condiciones de vida, el labora para como vigilante para una institucion privada, su esposa es domestico y entre los dos luchan dia a dia para salir adelante, con este credito comprara Materiales de Construccion como Inodoro, Ceramica, Cemento, etc. Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Aner lives with his wife in the Veracruz area of the town of Ticuantepe.  His biggest dream is to finish building his house so he has better living conditions.  He works as a security guard for a private institution and his wife is a housekeeper.  Together they strive every day to get ahead.

With this loan he'll buy construction materials such as a toilet, tiles, cement, etc.

He's grateful for the support and for the trust that AFODENIC and Kiva have placed in him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that, thanks to her hard work, she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family.

Monica is requesting a loan to buy produce such as cereals, potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes for her green grocery store. She will use the profits from her loan to reinvest into her business. Monica is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy cereals, potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Anjelyne

texts.en:
Anjelyne is a single woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Anjelyne has operated a boutique business, operating at the market whereby passersby and friends are her potential customers. She faces stiff competition from other boutique operators in her business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, for resale at her boutique shop.

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.en:
Giuliana is a Peruvian artisan who crafts sterling silver jewelry. She hopes to stock up on sterling silver while its price is low, and to develop a good supply of designs.

Giuliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"As a child, I loved creating my own jewelry to wear at parties, or to give as gifts to friends. In college, I signed up for elective courses in jewelry making, where I learned the essentials of the craft. For me, this was a hobby I kept refining and perfecting. I was still taking courses when my husband passed away. At that point, I quit school to seek a steady job to support my young son. That has been the greatest challenge of my life. I decided to set up my own workshop where I could develop my jewelry designs. My designs speak of tradition yet are modern, and they feature the harmony between metal, pearls and gemstones. I'd like to show the world the hand-crafted filigree styles developed in Peru over the centuries. I have researched the theme at length and my findings have led me to experiment with many great materials. Andean opal is my favorite."

"I'd like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping to fund this loan. Many thanks for your generous support. Please know that all my designs will be made with the highest quality, crafted with total dedication and echoes of love."

Use the link below to view Giuliana's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4994

loans.use: to stock up on sterling silver while its price is low, and to develop a good supply of designs

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.en:
Ubaldina and her family are ceramic artisans who specialize in Cuzco-style pottery. She would like to invest in the materials they use so that they can increase production.

Ubaldina has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"Our family's journey in the ceramic arts has been influenced by the customs and lifestyles of my village, a village of ceramic artisans. We dress our jars and decorative plates in beautiful designs from ancient Peru. Each carries the powerful, elemental mystery of water and earth. In our home-based workshop we also teach other ceramists in our tradition and many have stayed to work with us."

"To all of you who have helped fund this microcredit, I would like to send you a thousand blessing from my whole family. Many thanks for your wonderful support."

Use the link below to view Ubaldina and family's Cuzco ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1562

loans.use: to invest in the materials they use so that they can increase pottery production

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 60-years-old married woman. She is the mother of five boys and one girl. 

Iman is currently selling low quality blankets that she wants to enhance. For this reason, she applied for this loan in order to purchase a better quality of blankets and new bed cover sets for different seasons.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality of bedding merchandise.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handmade ceramic masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of ceramic and pigments, as well as to pay artisans' wages.

Salomon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I am a self-taught artist, dedicating myself to ceramics since my youth. I specialize in masks influenced by the Vicus, Moche, and Nazca cultures. I focus largely on the mix of form and color: despite a lack of formal training, I have created a unique, personal style. I hope to improve my work with each passing day, and achieve a style that is gratifying for me and that will resonate in people's hearts and minds."

"I would like to express my profound gratitude to all of you for funding this microcredit. Thanks to these funds I'll be able to build up my stock and increase sales. Thank you very much." 

Use the link below to view Salomon's ceramic masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/810

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ceramic and pigments, as well as to pay artisans' wages

loans.name: Pelise

texts.en: Pelise is 23 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a new frying pan and ingredients for her pancakes. In the future, Pelise hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, vegetable oil and baking soda.

loans.name: Handaru

texts.en:
Handaru is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in Javanase batik art. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood and wax, in order to increase production.

Handaru has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I come from a region renowned for batik artistry. I transfer traditional textile batik techniques to wood. I specialize in Indonesian batik ornaments, but focus more in the classic styles of Yogya and Solo. The color I use is 'sogan,' or brown, a trademark of the Yogya-Solo style."

"I want to add new designs to my collection, and this microcredit will make it possible for me to carry out my plan.  I want to make batik become more familiar to all the people in the world, not only in Indonesia, and I hope they come to appreciate batik as an ancient art form that will sustain and grow in time. Thanks for supporting me and my project, and for loving Javanese batik. This microcredit will go toward the preservation of the batik legacy for the world."

Use the link below to view Handaru's handcrafted batik art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1572

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and wax, in order to increase production

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Josefa is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 (Christ is the Hope 1, 2 & 3). She lives with her long-term partner and their four children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugar cane workers where she, her family, and the other 14 micro-entrepreneur women in this group reside.

Josefa says that her most important challenges are to have her own house in the main city, and to raise, educate and support her children. She operates a fruits and vegetables stall, a place where she sells goods to make the daily food. Normally she sells to her neighbors. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods to resell, including vegetables, fruits, meats, and charcoal. 

Josefa is excited to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza, each previous one having helped her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Josefa thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, and other goods to resell at her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inventory, including blouses, tracksuits, and boots, for resale

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted wood and leather furniture and mate gourd decor. She would like to invest in materials and also to hire assistants to help create her pieces.

Rocio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"Although I have taken courses in artistic design, I consider myself self-taught, since I have learned more from practice over the years. My work strives to show the inherent goodness of artisan labor. I enjoy sharing and teaching something of our own culture. I've formed a small working community of artisan families. Apart from working with gourds, I also design unique home furnishings that focus only on natural materials."

"I'd like to say that I am most grateful for all this support. Thanks to this microcredit, we can create more stock and constantly increase our sales. Thank you so much! I send you a heartfelt hug."

Use the link below to view Rocio's mate gourd décor and leather furniture on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2003

loans.use: to invest in materials and also to hire assistants to help create her pieces

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

Nelly has been farming rice for 7 years and also earns additional income from fishing, raising ducks, and running a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice farming, general store, fishing and livestock businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth. She previously accessed a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase quantities of materials like fabric, thread and other supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Ruth would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy additional materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ruth dreams that her tailoring business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates an agriculture business in coconut production to earn a living. She has had this business for over 8 years and earns 40,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for coconut production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for coconut production.

loans.name: Qutfi

texts.ru: Кутфи 58 летняя замужняя женщина. У нее один сын, который женат и имеет троих детей. Они все вместе живут в городе Истаравшан на севере Таджикистана. Кутфи работает в сфере торговли более 11 лет. На рынке города у нее есть торговая точка, где она занимается продажей детских одежд. В месяц дважды Кутфи закупает оптом свой товар с рынка города Душанбе, привозит товар в свой город Истаравшан и продает по розничной цене. В ее бизнесе помогает сын. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Кутфи запрашивает кредит для закупа сезонной детской одежды на продажу.
texts.en: Qutfi is 58 years old, married, and has one son who is married and has 3 children of his own. They all live together in the city of Istaravshan in the north of Tajikistan. Qutfi has been working in retail for over 11 years. She has a kiosk at the central market where she sells children's clothing. Twice a month, she purchases inventory from a wholesaler in Dushanbe, brings it back to Istaravshan, and sells it at retail. Her son helps her with the business. Qutfi is now seeking a loan to buy children's seasonal clothing to sell so she can increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy children's seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been in her business for 16 years and earns 35,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 47 years old, married, and has nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Juvy requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to resell at her store, like rice, snack foods and seasonings. She would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell at her store, like rice, snack foods and seasonings.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Ama did not have access to any form of formal education. However, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ama prepares and sells ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava) in her village of Ekumfi-Twa (near the Cape Coast). Alongside her gari she also sells soft drinks as well. She has been doing so for about 5 years. 

She is married to a farmer, and together they have 6 children. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava and soft drinks, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava and soft drinks, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more kinds of frozen foods. He was able to generate more income, and it helped his family financially. He also has a farm, and he attends to both of his businesses. He and his wife are working hand-in-hand, to give a good future to their family.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. He will use part of the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other inputs for maintenance of the farm. He will also use another part of the loan to buy different frozen foods. His profits from his businesses will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Felix hopes that his business will continue to grow. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other inputs for his farm, and to buy frozen foods to resell at his store business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 64 years old and widowed with eleven children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, diapers, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with eight children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Grace dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susuna

texts.en:
Susuna is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Zamboanga del Sur. 

Susuna owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over two years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. Now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and candies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and candies.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz de 35 años de edad , es soltera , sin responsabilidades familiares por el momento y vive en una casa alquilada.Docente de profesión, pero emprendedora de vocación viene dando sus servicios educativos en una escuela de su localidad , pero hace un tiempo optó por aperturar un pequeño salón de belleza en el primer piso de una vivienda que tomo en calidad de alquiler puesto que paralelo a sus estudios como docente aprendió mediante cursos acelerados las técnicas de corte para damas y caballeros.Con sus ahorros compro muebles, espejos y otros articulos logrando asi implementar su negocio.
Dentro de su concurrida clientela podemos hallar a vecinos y amigos de su barrio así como a sus propios alumnos a quienes les brinda una tarifa preferencial.
Desea con el tiempo implementar aun mas su negocio en un mejor local y ambiente logrando consolidarlo como un buen negocio. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva  y se compromete a pagar de manera puntual.
Para esta ocasión desea contar con S/.1,000 nuevos soles y comprar más sillas así como la renovación de algunos artículos de belleza.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 35 years old, single, and without family responsibilities at the moment and lives in a rented home.  She is a teacher by profession, but vocational entrepreneur offering her educational services at a school in her neighborhood, but some time ago she decided to open a little beauty salon in the first floor of her housing that takes in towards the rent as she can simultaneously carry on teaching accelerated haircutting courses for women and men. With her savings she bought furniture, mirrors, and other items successfully establishing her business. 

Among her clientele can be found friends and neighbors from her locale as well as her own students to whom she gives a special discount. She hopes to eventually establish her venture in a better facility and environment  strengthening as a good business. This is her first Kiva loan and she agrees to making her payments on time.

At this time she is asking for 1,000 soles to buy more chairs as well as the replacement of some beauty items.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: E-Koue Group

texts.fr: Le groupe E-KOUE est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Kaï Rose, est âgée 58 ans. Kaï Rose est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Kaï Rose est veuve avec  six enfants dont deux à sa charge et un scolarisé. Kaï Rose n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Kaï Rose vend des beignets et des divers( sardines, savons, huiles) à son domicile depuis prêt de vingt six ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Kaï Rose désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Kaï Rose sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe E-KOUE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group E-KOUE consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Kaï Rose, seen in the photo with her hand raised. Kaï Rose, age 58, is the widowed mother of six children, two of them still in her care, and one going to school. Kaï Rose never went to school. 

She has been selling beignets and various products (sardines, soap, oil) from her home for nearly 26 years, which allows her to support herself fairly easily. 

To better meet customer demand, Kaï Rose wishes to strengthen her activity. To that end, she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group E-KOUE. Both past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and various items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 51 years old, married and has four children.

Susan is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Susan has been farming rice and vegetables for thirty years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 38 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.  

Angeline is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, nylon, seeds and fertilizers.

Angeline has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nylon, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 55 years old and married with three children.

Rosie is in the agricultural business, farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, seedlings and other farm supplies.

Rosie has been farming vegetables for twenty-one years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with three children.  

Edna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is 42 years old, and widowed with 4 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests rice to earn a living by selling it. She has been in this business for over 8 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her farm.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

Jovelyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future. Jovelyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Geneive

texts.en: Geneive is 26 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell in her store.

Perla has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, a 42-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn an income for their everyday expenses.

Cecilia operates a vegetable farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite. It is located in the highlands where it is suitable to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies products to, as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cecilia dreams of giving her family a good future and dreams to expand her business. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Delvina Gomes

texts.en:
A 1,000 USD loan has been offered to Delvina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee, as well as a refrigerator to keep drinks cold. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Delvina independent because she can be responsible for herself. She can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. Antonia is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Antonia has been in this business for 12 years now and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her motorcycle transport and charcoal and firewood businesses.

In the future, Antonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en: Martinha is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about running a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better now that she has applied for her $1000 loan: with it, she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for offering loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Ma. Chuchie

texts.en:
Ma. Chuchie is 50 years old and widowed with seven children, five of whom are currently going to school. Ma. Chuchie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Ma. Chuchie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ma. Chuchie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru: Ориф житель города Истаравшан, расположенный в северной части Таджикистана. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и у него два сына и одна дочь. В течение 10 лет Ориф занимается земледелием. У него 15га орошаемой земли, на которой он выращивает лук и ячмень. В ведении сельского хозяйства ему помогают жена и дети. Ориф запрашивает кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян лука. Он хочет получить хороший урожай лука для продажи.
texts.en: Orif is a resident of the town of Istaravshan, which is located on the north part of Tajikistan. He is 47 years old. He is married and has two sons and one daughter. During the ten years Orif has been in land cultivation. He has 15 hectares of arable land where he grows onions and barley. His wife and children help him in his farming business. Orif is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and onion seeds. He wants to get a good harvest of onion for selling.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and onion seeds.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a hardworking mother who was blessed with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community. She was separated from her husband due to family problems and unavoidable circumstances. Despite that, she has a strong determination to give her children a better life. In addition to farming, she also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She planned to improve the business, but she has inadequate capital. She is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace más de 50 años se dedica a la agricultura; oficio que aprendió de su padre. Él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a prepararse junto a su esposa e hijos para irse a trabajar a los 14,000 metros cuadrados de su cultivo de maíz. Durante toda la mañana trabajan y en la tarde sus hijos se van para la escuela, mientras que Pablo se dedica a realizar otros quehaceres para llevar el alimento al hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago del alquiler del terreno. De esta manera, podrá sembrar sin problemas el maíz para recibir ingresos que le permitan llevar el alimento a su familia y poder comprar unas vacas lecheras para vender lácteos.
texts.en:
Pablo, 66, is married and has two children.  For more than 50 years he has worked in agriculture, which he learned from his father.  He gets up at 4 a.m. along with his wife and children to get ready to go to work on his 14,000-square-meter corn crop.  They work all morning and in the afternoon his children go to school while Pablo does other tasks to support the household.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy manure, seed, pesticide, and herbicide, and to pay rent on his plot of land.

This way he'll be able to plant corn without any problems so he can earn the income to support his family and be able to buy some dairy cows to sell dairy products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, pesticide, and herbicide, and to pay rent on his land

loans.name: Kaylyn

texts.en:
Kaylyn is 22 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Kaylyn requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bamboo, nylon, pesticides and fertilizers.

Kaylyn has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activities.

In the future, Kaylyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nylon, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
This is Nazaria, a 53-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. A widow, she and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nazaria operates a fruit stand, buying seasonal fruits to sell that are native to the Philippines such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papayas and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are the people in her community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nazaria is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Nazaria hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will continue to have the strength to discharge all of her responsibilities. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 47 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Judith has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for three years, and she also earns an income from raising livestock. Judith aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Eramae

texts.en: Eramae is 25 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eramae applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, bamboo, nylon and other farm supplies. Eramae has been farming vegetables for three years, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Eramae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bamboo, nylon and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly, 44 years old, is married to Jerry, a father who is busy managing their farm. Nelly runs her sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for five years, and she usually earns PHP 300 a day. Nelly and her husband help each other raise their children. Now Nelly needs additional funds to re-stock the general store. Nelly is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and assorted breads, to sell. She hopes that she can get her loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and assorted breads, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old, married and has three children attending school. She manages a small business selling meat at the market. She hopes to keep improving her income for the education of her children but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed for hogs and more meat to sell. With the help of this loan, she will be able to sustain her business and further improve her income. 

Evangeline will be happy and proud to one day see all of her children be professionals in their chosen careers.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs and more meat to sell.

loans.name: El Me Da La Mano Group

texts.es: Grupo formado pòr tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gricela tiene 15 años de tener una panadería en su domicilio, tiene dos trabajadores asalariados y  un hijo que le ayuda en el negocio , de estar en la institución tiene un años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, azúcar, levadura, colorantes, rodaminas, canelas etc. Marina tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio y Avis tiene 39 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de artesanías.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Gricela, who has had a bakery in her house for 15 years. She has two salaried workers and a son who help her with her business. She has been in the institution for one year. She will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, food coloring, rhodamine dye, cinnamon, etc.

Marina is 57 years old and her business is selling food in her home. Avis is 39 years old and her business is handicrafts sales.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, food coloring, rhodamine dye, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Cresigola

texts.en: Cresigola works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling coconut shells in the Philippines. Cresigola applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more coconut shell to sell. Cresigola has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cresigola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shell to sell.

loans.name: Nereo

texts.en: Nereo lives at Cataggaman with his spouse and five children. He has a business of selling bananas to the people in their village. He buys at wholesale prices and sells at retail. He is able to generate approximately PHP 10,000 monthly, and he uses it for meals, bills at home, education fees and revolving capital in his business. His wife helps him manage the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
