Vera is 23 years old and lives with her child and partner in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. To make a living, for over three years she has owned farmland upon which she plants and harvests vegetables such as squash, eggplant, etc., earning 10,000 PHP every month.

A member of GDMPC since 2011, Vera has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga es una mujer casada de 41 años de edad que de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos los cuales viven en casa ya que son menores de edad y junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura especialmente en el cultivo y siembra de café actividad que realiza hace más de 5 años ya que fue su esposo quien le enseño dicha actividad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa; pero no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos. Actualmente su esposo y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual dependen sus hijos. El cultivo de café queda a una distancia de 200 metros de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie hasta sus cultivos.

Doña Dominga está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo.  

Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido, las ganancias que quedan son pocas, pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar y fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Dominga, a 41-year-old married woman, has four minor children who live with them.  She and her husband work in agriculture, specifically growing coffee.  Her husband taught her this work, which they've done for more than five years.  She completed elementary school but wasn't able to continue studying because her parents' income was very low.

Currently she and her husband are each other's mutual support to get ahead, which their children depend on.  The coffee crop is about 200 meters from her house, so she walks there.

Dominga's requesting help to buy fertilizer, manure, and fumigation bombs to maintain her coffee crop.  If she doesn't take care of the crop in time it can become damaged by the blight that especially affects this type of crop.

She dreams of educating her children so they have a better quality of life and better job opportunities.  Working the land is difficult and with so much environmental contamination and the lack of materials, the profit is very small.  With the loan, however, she'll be able to prepare and strengthen her crop and have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and fumigation bombs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene con 33 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de 15 y 10 años respectivamente. Posee una vivienda hecha a base de material noble donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Tiene como principal tarea la atención en una tienda de comestibles , trabajo que viene desempeñando desde hace 5 años.
Comenta que antes de optar de manera permanente con su actual negocio probó con otros comercios llegando a quedarse con la venta de productos considerados primera necesidad y otros característicos de su rubro; puesto que no había tiendas de ese tipo en su localidad , esta labor le permite conocer amistades y hacerse muy conocida.Para un mejor desempeño cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos quienes la ayudan ya sea en tareas menores o haciéndose cargo del negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida te tener un apoyo financiero que le permita crecer económicamente.
Requiere en esta ocasión contar con S/. 4,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en la compra de un mostrador para ampliar su negocio así como mercadería para abastecer su negocio tales como arroz, azúcar, verduras, conservas, y otros de gran demanda.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 33, is married and has two minor children, ages 15 and 10.  She has a house made from sturdy material where she shares her family experiences.

Her main job is tending to a grocery store, work she has been doing for five years.  She says that before making a final choice about her current business she tried other commercial businesses.  She ended up staying with selling products that are considered to be basic necessities and other products characteristic of her field.

Given that there were no other stores like this in her area, this work allowed her to make friends and become very well-known.  To do a better job, she has the support of her children.  They help her, whether it be with small jobs or taking care of the business.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She feels very grateful to have a monetary support that allows her to grow financially.

She now needs to have 4,000 soles to buy a display case in order to expand her business.  She will also buy merchandise to stock her business.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, vegetables, canned goods, and other products that are in great demand.

loans.use: to buy a display case and food products like rice and sugar, among others.

loans.name: José Erasmo

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad. Se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace unos 10 años, aprendió el oficio con unos amigos. Antes era agricultor; pero se vio en la necesidad de migrar a otro domicilio en donde el único oficio es la pesca. Un día estaba acobiado, porque no tenia como llevar el alimento a su familia y en ese momento pasaron unos amigos que iban a pescar y lo invitaron para que aprendiera. Luego, con mucho esfuerzo solicito un crédito para comprar una lancha usada y de esta manera poseer su equipo de pesca propio. Para comprar los insumos para la pesca debe caminar a pie diez minutos, para abordar un autobús durante una hora y media. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar la parte interior de la lancha; ya que es única fuente de ingresos y cuando se le daña no trabaja y el alimento en su casa escasea. Su propósito, es construir su propia casa, ya que donde vive no es de él.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old. He has been working in fishing for about 10 years, learning the trade from some friends. He was in agriculture but he saw the necessity of moving to another domicile where the only business is fishing.

One day he was overwhelmed because he had no way of feeding his family and just then some friends passed by who were going fishing and they invited him so he could learn. Later, through a lot of struggle, he asked for a loan to buy a used boat so he would have his own fishing equipment. In order to buy fishing supplies he has to walk for 10 minutes and then board a bus for 1-1/2 hours.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Camp, is to repair the inside of the boat as it is the only source of income and when it’s damaged he can’t work and food is in short supply at home. 

His goal is to build his own home as the home he lives in is not his.

loans.use: to repair the inside of his boat as it is his only source of income

loans.name: Ermelinda Das Dores

texts.en: In order to improve her business, a $1,000.00 loan is offered to Ermelinda, who lives in town with her family. Ermelinda, who opened her kiosk in 2010, will use it to buy stocks for her store including cow's milk, soy sauce, honey, wax oil, and sleepers. She is generating a good income from her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy cow's milk, soy sauce, honey, wax and oil.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a 50-year-old married mother of five children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. In the pig-fattening business in the Philippines for 15 years, she has requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es: Betsy es integrante del grupo “Unidos Para El Progreso” conformado por 06 socios entusiastas dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales.  Betsy es cosmetóloga brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, tintes, manicure y tratamientos capilares. Se siente orgullosa pues cada vez mejora su negocio y de igual manera aumenta sus clientes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras y cremas.  Su mayor deseo es de mejorar su salón de belleza. Betsy tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene  02 hijos aún dependientes. El grupo “Unidos Para El Progreso” agradece el crédito y la confianza brindada.  Betsy es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo blanco con rayas rojas. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo se encuentra Jorge.
texts.en: Betsy is a member of the “Unidos Para El Progreso” [United for Progress] Communal Bank, which is comprised of six enthusiastic members who are engaged in various business activities.  Betsy is a cosmetologist and provides services such as haircuts, hair coloring, manicures, and hair treatments.  She feels proud of herself because she is continually improving her business and likewise, increasing her number of clients.  She is requesting the loan to purchase dyes, scissors, and creams.  Her greatest desire is to improve her beauty salon.  Betsy is 37 years old, married, and has two children that are still dependent.  The “Unidos Para El Progreso” Communal Bank in grateful for the loan and the trust placed in them.  In the photo, Betsy is the second from the right and is wearing a white polo shirt with red stripes.  At the top left side is Jorge.  .

loans.use: to purchase dyes, scissors, and creams.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is from the village of Guam. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns and operates a furniture-making business. She has been engaged in her business for almost three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. 

At this time, Maribel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase raw materials for making additional furniture. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 61 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and she earns an additional income from buying and selling of dry goods.

She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to resell at her general store, like bread, noodles, candies, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to resell at her general store, like bread, noodles, candies, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Oluwatogni 307 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWATOGNI 307  est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Fidèle Rachelle, est âgée 40 ans. Fidèle Rachelle est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Fidèle Rachelle est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple à quatre enfants,dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Fidèle Rachelle et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Fidèle Rachelle n'a pas fréquenté. Fidèle Rachelle vend des lubrifiants à son domicile depuis dix huit, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Fidèle Rachelle désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Fidèle Rachelle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOGNI 307, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The OLUWATOGNI 307 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. 

The group’s representative is Fidèle Rachelle, who is 40 years old and can be seen holding up her hand in the photo. 

Fidèle Rachelle is married to a man named Joseph. The couple have four children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are still dependent on their parents. Fidèle Rachelle and her husband live together with their children and share the various household costs. 

Fidèle Rachelle did not go to school. She has been selling lubricants from home for 18 years, which enables her to meet her family’s needs without too much difficulty. 

In order to improve customer satisfaction, Fidèle Rachelle wishes to strengthen her business. In order to do this, Fidèle Rachelle has requested a second loan from Alidé along with the other members of the OLUWATOGNI 307 group.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants.

loans.name: Da-Yato Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DA-YATO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Akouavi Pélagie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  Akouavi Pélagie est âgée de 41 ans, est  mariée à Fataï. Le couple à quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer.  Akouavi Pélagie a fréquenté jusqu'au niveau primaire. Il y a près de douze ans que  Akouavi Pélagie exerce comme activité, la vente des produits cosmétiques et des tissus à son domicile. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle,  Akouavi Pélagie désire acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire,  Akouavi Pélagie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DA-YATO, un premeir crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The DA-YATO group has three members who all live in the same neighbourhood. The group leader, Akouavi Pélagie, is shown in the photo with her hand raised. 

Akouavi Pélagie is 41 years old and married to Fataï. The couple have four children, some of whom are in school. The couple live together with their children and are jointly responsible for the various household costs. 

Akouavi Pélagie attended school to primary level. For nearly 12 years, she has been running a business selling cosmetics and fabrics from home. This enables her to provide for her family without too much difficulty. 

In order to better meet her customers’ needs, Akouavi Pélagie would like to buy cosmetic products and fabrics to reinforce her business. In order to do this, she has requested her first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the DA-YATO group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and fabrics.

loans.name: Ste Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Ste TRINITE  est formé de trois personnes qui sont des parentés. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sourou Laurence, âgée de 27 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sourou Laurence est célibataire sans enfants. Sourou Laurence vit seule et assurent seule les charges de la maison. Sourou Laurence a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Il y a près de dix neuf ans que Sourou Laurence exerce comme activité, la vente des tissus et des chaussures; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ces besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sourou Laurence désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Sourou Laurence sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe Ste TRINITE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ste TRINITE group has three members, who are all related. 

The group leader, Sourou Laurence, is 27 years old and can be seen holding up her hand in the photo. 

Sourou Laurence is single and has no children. She lives alone and is responsible for her own household costs. She attended school to primary level and
has been running a business selling fabrics and shoes for almost 19 years, which enables her to provide for herself without any great problem. 

In order to better respond to customer demand, Sourou Laurence wishes to strengthen her business. She has therefore requested a fourth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Ste TRINITE group. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Cresilyn

texts.en:
Cresilyn is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Cresilyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cresilyn has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cresilyn would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Agban-Lin Group

texts.fr: AGBAN-LIN est un groupe de trois personnes, qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, Honorine Julienne Cica (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Honorine Julienne Cica est veuve. Honorine Julienne Cica à quatre enfants dont trois à sa charge et certains scolarisés. Honorine Julienne Cica a  fréquenté l’école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a près de quinze ans que Honorine Julienne Cica mène comme activité la vente de frites d'ignames à son domicile. Honorine Julienne Cica mène cette activité afin de pouvoir à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Honorine Julienne Cica s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Honorine Julienne Cica sollicite un troixième crédit avec les membres du groupe AGBAN-LIN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. les prêts antérieurs ont été bien rembourser.
texts.en:
AGBAN-LIN is a group with three members, who all live together. 

The leader of the group, Honorine Julienne Cica (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old. She is a widow and has four children, three of whom are still dependent and some of whom go to school. 

Honorine Julienne Cica herself attended school to secondary level and it is nearly 15 years since she started her business selling yam fries from home. She does this in order to provide for her own needs and those of her children. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

In order to improve customer satisfaction, Honorine Julienne Cica is requesting a third loan, along with the other members of the AGBAN-LIN group. This loan will help her to meet customer demand and make a bigger profit. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy yams, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 48 años de edad es una mujer casada, madre de 5 hijos en las edades de 19 a 28 años, que presta su servicio de belleza a domicilio entre población de mujeres y jóvenes que son sus principales clientes. Ella inició Este negocio hace 2 años, cuando haciendo cursos aprendió y experimentó  en el cabello de sus amigos y familiares, mientras estudiaba. Desde esa época todos los días tiene clientes que atender de lunes a domingos, su meta mas adelante es  ubicarse en un local donde pueda atender a la clientela que ha construido día a día. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hae a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos de belleza, como tintes, esmaltes, productos capilares etc. Con esta inversión logrará descuentos que disminuirán sus costos y aumentaran sus ingresos, lo cual hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of five children between the ages of 19 and 28 years old. She provides her beauty services at home to her main clients, who are women and young people. 

Lourdes began this business two years ago; she learned by taking courses and experimenting on the hair of her friends and families while she was studying. Since that time, she has had clients to attend to every day from Monday to Sunday. Her goal for the future is to establish herself in a commercial location where she can serve the clientele that she has been building day after day. 

Lourdes is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; she will use the loan to buy beauty supplies like hair color, nail polish, haircare products, etc. With this investment, she will receive discounts that will reduce her costs and increase her income, which will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies, like hair color, nail polish, and haircare products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to pay for her laborers' salaries and to buy additional sacks of fertilizer.

Lucia has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business farming sugarcane and her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for her laborers' salaries and buy additional sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maileen

texts.en:
As a single woman, Maileen works hard to support her parents. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by farming sugarcane. 

Maileen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to resell at her general store, like soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

She has been sustaining her business activities, with the help of one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to resell at her store, like soap, shampoo, and canned goods

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Her general store is the primary source of income for Emelia. She has been running her business for three years. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four children. They live in the village of Guam.

At this moment, Emelia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to buy condiments, beverages, and assorted breads to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested, to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments, beverages and assorted breads to sell at her general store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Lucia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income by raising livestock.
 
She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional products to resell at her store, like oil, rice, and other groceries.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell at her store, like oil, rice, and other groceries

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 54-years-old and is married to Rodrigo. To earn a living, Milagros is involved in a retail business. She usually sells bananas in the village of Guam. She has been in this business for five years. Milagros wanted to buy more fruits to sell, but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for  a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy more bananas to sell. She hopes to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 38-years-old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She has been with GDMPC since 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires

loans.name: Lkhasurenjav

texts.en: Lkhasurenjav is 32-years-old, and lives with her mother, sister and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. She herself has been running a shoe sales business since 2012 and in one year she attracted numerous customers to her business. She divorced her husband one year ago and moved to her mother's home. The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks. As a result, her family can live in warm and comfortable place. More importantly, the family will burn less coal, reduce carbon emissions contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old, married and has three children. She is a vendor and sells firewood and charcoal to the people in her village. She buys firewood and charcoal at a wholesale price and sells them at retail. She has been in this business for over ten years now. She earns about 10,000 PHP each month which pays for matriculation fees and daily expenses.   

Norma would like to increase her income, which is why she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell. This will help her  make good sales and income for the family.
 
Norma hopes to keep providing a good education to her children. She will be happy and proud to see all her children with good employment some day.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a 60-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest is 24 and the youngest is 18-years-old. She's involved in a mat weaving business. She has been in this business for 20 years now. This is the source of her income.  Lucila is requesting for a loan to buy buri (palm leaves) and wicker.

loans.use: to buy buri (palm leaves) and wicker

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 79 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 30 years, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to resell at her general store, like sugar, milk, spices, soap, and canned goods.

Nicanora has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is requesting a new loan to further build her general store and pig fattening businesses. Nicanora aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at her general store, like sugar, milk, spices, soap, and canned goods.

loans.name: Monalin

texts.en:
Monalin is 36 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to resell at her general store, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo.

Monalin has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Nymfa

texts.en:
Nymfa is from the village of Guam. She generates income through her sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is 23 years old and married, and she has two children. She has been running her sari-sari store for four years and earns about a minimum of PHP 250 a day.

At this time, Nymfa is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000. She will use the loan to buy grocery items to resell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to sell more grocery items. She hopes that she will increase her income, to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit is 27 years old and has one child with her live-in partner. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Janit owns and operates a pedicab transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new tires for better services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for better services.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and accessories and also to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Her other child is already working and helps them with their finances. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Luisa hopes to be successful in all her businesses. She meets up with her *co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 41-year-old, married and has five children, two of which are in school.

Marisol is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marisol requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marisol has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marisol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fredilyn

texts.en: Fredilyn is 21-years-old and still single. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for one year. This business brings in a good profit both to the business and the family budget. Fredilyn dreams of lifting her family from poverty; this is why she works hard at her hog raising business. She also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. She also hopes to increase her business to secure a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nida is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise like sardines, biscuits and other grocery items needed for her general store business.

Nida has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like sardines, biscuits and other grocery items needed for her general store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, 34 años de edad, originaria  de León, acompañada, madre de 2 hijos de 2 y 13 años actualmente solo uno estudia, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la  costura,  de la que es propietaria hace mas de 13 años, con nivel académico universitaria , Licenciada en computación.
Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven, trabajando en la costura con su mama,  fue allí que adquirió   experiencia y dominio propio del negocio, es asi como ella lucha cada día para mantener estable  su negocio, para obtener mejores ingresos, este ha sido su primer negocio,  cuenta con el apoyo de una persona quien le ayuda  la costura, a la cual le paga mano de obra, sus ropa la  comercializa en otros Departamentos como León y Chinandega. Una de sus expectativas es  seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.
Ella esta requiriendo financiamiento para comprar  telas, zíper,  botones, encajes, hilos, etc. Ella  estima que el crédito le era de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus trajes, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder  ofrecer  ropa de calidad a  sus clientes, una de sus metas próximas es pagar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Ana is a 34 year old woman from León.  She is a common-law wife and mother of two children, ages 2 and 13.  Only one of them is in school right now.  She is a business woman, engaged in sewing and has owned her business for over 13 years.  She completed a university level education and has a degree in computer science.  

She began working in the business field when she was very young and worked in sewing with her mother.  It was there that she gained experience and mastery of the business.  She strives each day to keep her business steady and thereby, earn more income.  This is her first business and she has the support of a person that she pays to help her with the sewing.  She markets her clothing in other departments such as León y Chinandega.  One of her expectations is to continue growing her business.  

She is requesting financing to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, lace thread, etc.  She feels that the loan will be helpful because she will be able to buy all the raw material that she needs to make her outfits.  Included in her future plans, is to be able to offer quality clothing to her customers.  One of her next goals is to repay the loan and then reapply for another.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, bottons, lace, thread, etc.

loans.name: Moisés Salomón

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él es peluquero desde hace unos diez años; antes trabajaba cargando bultos de mercadería a las señoras que venden en el mercado y frente al lugar donde pasaba estaba una peluquería, entonces cuando no tenia que hacer se iba a sentar ahí a ver como trabajaban en la peluquería; un día una de las trabajadoras le pregunto si quería aprender y fue así como él aprendió. También, el veía que ganaban muy bien y él ganaba poquito y trabaja mucho. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para dar un anticipo para comprar una casa; ya que actualmente esta alquilando. Esta oportunidad la quiere aprovechar; ya que es uno de sus más grandes anhelos desde niño, tener una casa propia; ya que su padre los abandono y siempre tuvieron que alquilar. Además, desea enviar a su hijo a la escuela, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad por la pobreza de su madre.
texts.en:
Moisés is 25 years old, married and has a son. He has been a barber for some 10 years. Before, he worked carrying bundles of merchandise to the women who sell in the market. 

Facing the place where he passed was a barbershop, and when he had nothing to do, he began to sit there to see how they worked at the barbershop. One day one of the workers asked him if he wanted to learn and that was how he learned. Also he saw they that they earned good money, and he earned little and worked a lot. 

He is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to make a down payment on a house, as he is currently renting. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity, as having his own house has been one of his greatest dreams since he was a child. His father abandoned them and he has always had to rent. In addition he wants to send his son to school, as he didn't have that opportunity due to his mother's poverty.

loans.use: To make a downpayment on a house, as currently he is renting.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Насимчону 34 года. Он женат. У него два сына и одна дочь. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Истаравшан. Истаравшан находится на севере Таджикистана. Насимчон занимается земледелием. У него имеется земельный участок, где он выращивает сельско-хозяйственные культуры. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Одновременно она помогает мужу в ведении сельского хозяйства. Насимчон запрашивает кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он уже посеял пшеницу и теперь хочет обработать землю, чтобы получить богатый урожай.
texts.en: Nasimjon is 34 years old.  He is married.  He has two sons and one daughter.  He lives with his family in Istaravhsan.  Istaravshan is in the northern part of Tajikistan.  Nasimjon is a farmer.  He has a plot of land where he grows crops.  His wife is a high school teacher.  At the same time she helps her husband run the farm.  Nasimjon is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.  He has already planted wheat and now wants to fertilize the soil so that he gets a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish pond business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed for her fish and materials for the maintenance of her fish pond.

Mely has been in this business for 5 years. Mely earns additional income from a general store.

Mely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her fish and materials for the maintenance of her fish pond

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en: Alimaa, 53 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering printing, copying and photography services to local people for a year and is quite experienced in this field. She also earns income by renting her restaurant. The house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some repair. So she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, planks and cement. Using these materials she will repair her house. The renovated house will preserve heat more efficiently and enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a hardworking mother. She is 55 years old, married and has three children. She uses her cooking skills to make meals and snacks as her business. She also runs a store. Her spouse helps her in the business. From her businesses, she was able to generate an income of 10,000 PHP each month. The income goes for meals and revolving capital in the business. She hopes to improve her services and keep selling delicious foods, which is why she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy pork meat and chicken to cook and sell in her food stall.  She will also buy kitchen utensils to use in the food stall. This will help improve sales and keep generating good income from her business. 

Someday, Julia hopes to keep increasing profits in order to save funds for use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy pork meat and chicken to cook and sell in her food stall

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies and other operational needs for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their household and business expenditures. She is also a tricycle operator.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy supplies and operational needs for her billiard pool business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have more tricycles. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and operational needs for her billiard pool business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly, 46 years old, is married to a truck driver. To make a living she has managed a vegetable production business in their town for almost one year. In this business she's earning a net income of  3,000 PHP a month. She would like to avail a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize her loan in her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production business

loans.name: Ismael Isael

texts.es:
Ismael, es un humilde agricultor de 45 años de edad, originario de la comarca Santa Lucia en las afueras de Teustepe, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde muy joven. Inicio esta actividad desde muy joven trabajando a los 10 años edad junto con sus padres y sus hermanos para poder subsistir , solo logro finalizar la primaria. Actualmente se especializa en la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado durante el invierno se dedica  de tiempo completo a sembrar y almacenar granos para tener durante la época de verano de esta manera lograr vender durante la escasez una de las actividades que necesita reforzar es la crianza de ganado pero no cuenta con tierras  propias que le permitan tenerlo en mejores condiciones. El esta necesitando el financiamiento para pagar al alquiler de 3 manzanas de tierra y comprar plaguicidas para proteger sus cultivos de plaga y el pasto de sus animales. 
Una de sus metas próximas es sembrar sandias para diversificar sus siembras y lograr tener sus propias tierras para tener a sus animales en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Ismael is 45 years old. He is a humble farmer from the Santa Lucia district on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He has been planting corn and beans since he was very young.  He started this activity when he was very young and at ten years old, he worked along with his parents and siblings so that the family could survive.  He was only able to complete primary school.  Currently, he specializes in planting basic grains and breeds livestock in the winter.  He dedicates himself full-time to planting and storing grains to have for the summer season and in this way, he is able to sell during shortage periods.   One of the activities that he needs to strengthen is the livestock breeding but he doesn’t have his own land and so he does not have land that is in good condition.  He needs financing to pay the lease on 3 “manzanas” [land measure = 1.75 acres] and to purchase insecticide to protect his crops and animal pastures from blight. One of his next goals is to plant watermelon to diversify his crops and to have his own land so that is animals will have better conditions.

loans.use: to pay the lease on 3 "manzanas" of land and to purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell in her buy and sell livestock business.

Nerry has been in this business for 3 years. Nerry earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

Nerry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 57 years old, married ahd has four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nicanora is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines and additional livestock for her business.

Nicanora has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 42 years old, married, and has children. Her husband is a farmer. She herself works as a business woman and is very experienced. Perla is one of the most influential workers in her community. She, her husband and her children help each other to sustain the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy T-shirts, shoes, sandals and personal use items to sell in her business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shoes, sandals and personal use items to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a welding machine for her son's welding business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a prawn vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Ruth has been in this business for 5 years. Ruth earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Melva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Melva, 51 años de edad, casada, madre de  4 hijos todos ellos viven independiente, ella se dedica atender una pulpería, en la comarca Las Banderas en las afueras de Teustepe. Comenzo con capital que le dio su esposo quien trabaja como vendedor de piedras para construcción. Sus primeros productos fueron azúcar, verduras, frijoles, aceite y arroz. Actualmente vende gaseosas, detergentes, cloro, jabones, la necesidad de surtir su pulpería es a diario pues en esta comunidad son escasas este tipo de negocios.    
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles, verduras, ropa, cosméticos, productos de limpieza, jabones de baño, papel higiénico etc.  Ella anhela ir mejorando su negocio hacerlos más estable puede cubrir parte de las necesidades alimentarias de su clientela.
texts.en: Melva is 51 years old.  She is married with four independent children.  She owns a general store in the Las Banderas district on the outskirts of Teustepe.  She started with capital given to her by her husband who works as a salesman selling stones for construction.  Her first products were sugar, vegetables, beans, oil, and rice. Now, she sells soda, detergent, bleach, and soap.  She needs to stock her general store daily because this type of business is scarce in this community.    She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, oil, rice, beans, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, cleaning products, bath soaps, toilet paper, etc.  She wishes to continue improving her business and make it more stable so that she can cover part of the food needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, rice, beans, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, cleaning products, bath soaps, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Pedra works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Pedra is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Pedra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula is 45 years old, married and has five children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Romula is borrowing 19,500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Romula has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Mariana works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mariana is borrowing 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy materials for her broom-making business.

Mariana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her broom-making business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a woman of 54 years who lives with her seven children. For five years, she has been selling all kinds of food products.

Marilou sells her products from Monday to Sunday. Her customers are neighbors and friends who shop with her because she is friendly and provides good customer service. She is requesting this loan to buy food products such as soft drinks, juice, cookies, bread, butter, beans, sugar, rice, oil, pasta, sauces, salt, ice, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to further increase her inventory. She will also increase her turnover as she will have all kinds of products available to sell to her customers.

Marilou's dream is to have a well-stocked business where her customers can find all kinds of products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soap, snacks and spices for her store.

loans.name: Priscilla Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child who is in school, Priscilla Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Priscilla Jane is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell in her buy and sell charcoal and firewood business.

Priscilla Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 52 years old, married and has nine children. Seven of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Azucena has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Azucena requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

Azucena has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Azucena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving business

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a 20-year-old married woman and has no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants and banana trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Olive has requested a loan to buy equipment (bush knives, a wheelbarrow, shovels) and fertilizer to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Olive hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers and shovels for her business

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Rosela earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock.

Rosela is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en: Seneuefa is a 65-year-old woman who is married and has 4 children. She has a small business making and selling popcorn and pancakes. She has been in this business for 2 years. Seneuefa needs a loan to buy cooking oil, corn seeds, a large cooking pot, plastic bags, bags of flour, baking soda, sugar, salt and a gas oven. She will use her profits to improve her business. Seneuefa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, corn seeds, a large cooking pot, flour, baking soda, sugar, salt and a gas oven for her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has a shop where she sells essential items such as beans, milk, eggs and bread. She has had this business for 12 years, and this has provided her with sales experience that has allowed her to increase her sales. It is located in her house, and is well-known by the inhabitants of the area. She has a lot of customers, since her shop is well-stocked. 

Marissa wants to expand her business and carry out a new investment but she needs capital, and for this reason, she is asking for a loan so that she can buy the necessary items for her shop, and in this way improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and spices.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Шаходат живет в городе Канибадам, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей  сорок четыре года. По семейным обстоятельствам  Шаходат не смогла получить высшее  образование, так как с детства в ее семье были финансовые проблемы.   Супруг ее был вынужден уехать в РФ , так как были сложности с работой на родине.
  Шаходат занимается купле -продажей  хоз товаром. По началу ей было очень трудно так как она нуждалась в денежных средствах. В 2008 году она арендовала магазин для бизнеса и вот спустя пять лет на накопленные деньги от продажи хоз товаров она приобрела собственный магазин на местном рынке. В 2012 году по совету знакомых Шаходат обратилась в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит она  увеличила свой ассортимент и тем самым повысила свой семейный доход.   Она  очень рада, что обратилась в Арванд .  У нее  большие планы на будущее, она очень хочет, чтобы ее дети учились в высших учебных заведениях и поэтому старается  делать все, чтобы добиться своей цели. 
На полученный кредит  Шаходат  опять хочет купить хоз товары и увеличить свой ассортимент.   Она очень благодарна организации  Арванд, так как с помощью таких организаций люди, имеющие финансовые проблемы могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Shahodat lives in the city Kanibadam.  She is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She was unable to receive a higher education since her family has had financial problems since she was just a child.  Shahodat's husband is a migrant worker in Russia since it's difficult to find work in Tajikistan.  She buys and sells household products.  In the beginning, it was difficult because she needed funds.  In 2008, she rented a store at a local market and 5 years later, in 2012, she bought her own store with the money she earned.  Last year, she was advised to turn to Arvand to take out a loan.  With that capital, she expanded her selection of inventory and coincidentally increased her family's income.  She is very glad that she made the decision to use Arvand.  She has big plans for the future and very much wants her children to go to college and does everything in her power to reach this goal.  With this loan, Shahodat again will buy household products to expand her inventory.  She is very grateful to Arvand since with the help of such organizations, those with financial problems can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase household goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive con su esposo y su hijo en alquiler en la zona de Agua de la Vida de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una institución del Estado siendo un sostén importante en la economía de su familia.

Requiere el crédito para la compra de instrumentos musicales (dos guitarras acústicas, dos zampoñas, un bombo) ya que su hijo estudia para ser profesor de música.

El sueño de Beatriz es que su hijo cumpla su meta y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives with her husband and her son in a rented house in the area of Agua de la Vida, La Paz. She is an employee of a State institution and her job represents an important financial support for her family. 

She's requesting a loan to buy musical instruments (two acoustic guitars, two rustic flutes and a bass drum) for his son, who is studying to become a music teacher. Beatriz's dream is for him to fulfill his goal and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments for his son, who is studying to become a music teacher.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es estudiante de contabilidad, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como comerciante de joyas la mayor parte del día y estudia por las noches.

Reyna necesita el crédito para la compra de mercadería (anillos, aretes, brazaletes, etc.) ya que por comienzo de año, todo su presupuesto fue destinado a estudios.

El sueño de Reyna es terminar sus estudios y poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Reyna is an Accounting student and lives with her parents in the area of Miraflores, La Paz. She works selling jewelry most of the day and studies at night. 

She needs a loan to buy products (rings, earrings, bracelets, etc.) given that she spent all of her budget in tuition at the beginning of the year. 

Her dream is to finish her studies and to become independent.

loans.use: to buy rings, earrings, bracelets and other items for her jewelry sales business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a proud mother of four. Three of her children are now employed and her youngest child is still in high school. 

She is continuously generating income to maintain her ukay-ukay (used clothing) business and not only rely on her children's remittances. She also sells longganisa (pork sausages) for additional income. 

Maxima is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more used clothes, shoes, bags, and caps to sell. 

This will help maintain good profits from the business, and she will someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, shoes, bags, and caps to sell.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 34 years old and married with four children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vitaliana has a general store business in the Philippines. Vitaliana requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Vitaliana has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Vitaliana would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 35-years-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows banana trees and taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Matalena has requested a loan to buy equipment and fertilizer for the good of her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Matalena hopes to extend her business and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, and bush knives

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar, 35 años de edad, originario de la comarca Las Canoas, casado padre de 3 hijos  de 15,11 y 5años  edad, él se dedica a vender piedras canteras (piedras para la construcción de casas), lleva 5 años dedicándose a este negocio. El empezó trabajando como cargador de piedras desde  muy joven a veces era chofer otras trabajaba como vendedor y cargador al mismo tiempo pero se propuso ahorrar para comprar su camión con el objetivo de independizarse y emprender su propio negocio durante 5 años ahorro hasta lograr comprar su camión usado que se lo vendió su antiguo jefe. Él viaja hasta la capital Managua a vender piedras canteras tiene dos ayudantes. Le gusta salir adelante y tratar de darle lo mejor que puede a sus hijos él tiene como proyecto poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación para que su esposa la administre y de esta manera conseguir otras formas de ingreso. Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar 2 llantas  y piedras canteras para vender. 
El crédito le permitirá mantener en buenas condiciones su camión que es su herramienta principal así también tener material para vender. En lo futuro le gustaría comprar un camión.
texts.en: Oscar is 35 years old and he is from the Las Canoas district.  He is married and the father of three children, ages 15, 11, and 5.  He is engaged in selling quarry stone (stones for home construction) and has been in this business for five years.  He began working as a stone loader at a very young age.  Sometimes, he was a driver and at other times he worked as a salesman and loader at the same time.  But he put his mind to saving to buy a truck with the goal of becoming independent and establishing his own business.  He saved for five years until he was able to buy a used truck that his old boss sold to him.  He has two helpers when he makes the trip to the capital city of Managua to sell quarry stone.  He is pleased to be getting ahead and tries to provide the best he can to his children.  One of the projects he has planned is to install a general store in his home for his wife to manage and in this way, gain another source of income.  He is requesting the loan to purchase two tires and quarry stones to sell.  The loan will permit him to maintain his truck in good condition since it is his main tool.  In addition, he will have material to sell.  In the future, he would like to purchase a truck.

loans.use: to purchase two tires and quarry stones to sell.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot vive en alquiler con su familia en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una institución aseguradora.

Requiere el crédito para poder inscribir a su hijo a la Universidad y comprar los útiles y herramientas necesarias para cursar el primer semestre de estudios.

El sueño de Margot es preparar a su hijo para que pueda estudiar y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Margot rents a home with her family in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She works as an employee at an insurance company.

She needs the loan to register her son at college and buy the school supplies and tools he will need for his first semester of studies

Margot's dream is to prepare her son so he can to go to school and have a good career.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of her son's college registration.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana es soltera y vive en alquiler con su mamá y su hermano en un hogar humilde de la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz. Ella se dedica al comercio a través de una pequeña tienda de barrio la cual administra mientras no está estudiando.

Ella requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería (fideo, arroz, refrescos, azúcar, leche), ya que desea expandir su negocio y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su estilo de vida.

El sueño de Mariana es hacer crecer su negocio y poder conseguir un lugar propio para vivir.
texts.en:
Mariana is single.  She and her mother and her brother live in a humble, rented home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.  She runs a small neighborhood store when she is not in school.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, sugar, and milk).  She wishes to expand her business, increase her income, and improve her lifestyle.

Mariana’s dream is to make her business grow and to be able to get her own place to live.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, milk, and other products to stock her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es soltera y trabaja como secretaria en una entidad pública. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz. Lamentablemente su casa carece de infraestructura para poder ser habitada apropiadamente.

Es por eso que solicita el crédito, Emiliana quiere construir y refaccionar su hogar para poder ser habitable y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Necesita comprar ladrillos, arena, cemento y pagar a los albañiles.

El sueño de Emiliana es mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana is single.  She works as a secretary for a public entity.  She lives in her own house in the Vino Tinto area of the city of La Paz.  Sadly, her house lacks the infrastructure to be able to live in it suitably.

That is why she is requesting the loan.  Emiliana wants to build and repair her home in order to make it livable.  This way she will improve the quality of her life.  She needs to buy bricks, sand, and cement.  She also needs to pay the bricklayers.

Emiliana’s dream is to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, and cement, and to pay bricklayers to repair her house.

loans.name: Ailepata

texts.en: Ailepata is 39 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry, snacks, and soft drinks in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of rice, cartons of chicken, drinks, etc. In the future, Ailepata hopes to improve her business to help her kids' education and her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, cartons of chicken, onions, salt, cooking oil, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Telematina

texts.en: Telematina is 38 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells weaving fans, 'kava' bowls, 'tapa' cloths, carvings, 'kava' cups, and 'elei' (block printing) materials to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Telematina has requested a loan to buy wood for carvings, 'pandanus', paints, design boards, and carving tools. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wood for carving, as well as design boards, paints, and 'pandanus'

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de desinfectantes que el mismo prepara. Este negocio nación desde el 1999, cuando un amigo le enseñó a producirlos y desde ese mismo momento, empezó a vender. Poco a poco fue abordando a una clientela doméstica,  conformada por familiares y amigos y posteriormente abordó otros sectores ubicados alrededor de su vivienda donde los produce. En la actualidad requiere hacer compras de  insumos en un mayor volumen, para generar menores cosos de producción y ser más competitivos con sus precios y por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará escencias, envases, para aumentar el volumen de su producción. Sus ventas y sus compras las realiza de contado y sus principales clientes actuales, son los comerciantes propietarios de locales y hoteles. Su meta más adelante es convertirse en mayorista  y responder a la potencialidad que le brinda el mercado, con el fin de  aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 39, makes a living selling disinfectant that he himself makes.  He started the business in 1999 when a friend taught him to make the product and right then he began to sell it.  Little by little he began to build a domestic clientele made up of family members and friends, and later he attracted other sectors around his house where he makes the product.

Currently he needs to buy supplies in bulk to have lower production costs and be more competitive with his prices.  This is why he's requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He'll buy essences and containers to increase his production volume.

He makes his purchases and sales in cash and currently his main customers are merchants who own hotels and establishments.  His long-term goal is to become a wholesaler and respond to the potential demand of the market, with the goal of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy essences and containers

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 41 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad; allí de dedica  a la venta de accesorios para celulares y ofrece servicios técnicos  de mantenimiento y reparación de estos. Su idea de negocio nació desde el año 2009, cuando su cónyuge, por trabajar como empleado en un local, le propuso iniciar ese mismo negocio y reunieron un capital para emprenderlo. Su oferta la hace de contado, trabajando de  lunes a domingos y desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Los principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores, que poco a poco se han ido agregando a su base de clientes. Su meta es crecer y más adelante convertirse en mayorista, para darle a sus hijos oportunidades y tener un futuro de mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará accesorios para celulares, pues son los artículos que tienen una mayor rotación en su negocio y hacen de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Olga, 41 years old, lives in the town of Soledad. There, she sells accessories for cellular phones and offers technical maintenance and repair services. Her idea for this business was born in 2009 when her spouse, working as an employee in a store, proposed that she start the same business, and they gathered capital to launch it. 

She makes her sales in cash, working from Monday through Sunday, from 7 in the morning to 9 at night. Her main customers are her neighbors from her neighborhood and other sectors, which have, little by little, been adding to her client base. Her goal is to grow and later become a wholesaler to give her children opportunities and have future of greater prosperity.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will buy accessories for cellular phones. These are the items that have a higher turnover in her business and make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for cellular phones.

loans.name: Solanye Sarita

texts.es:
Solanye es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, Solanye es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, Solanye no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Solanye trabaja como empleada del hogar, brindando servicios de limpieza, lavandería y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Solanye se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho, ya que actualmente cuenta con una cocina a kerosene la cual presente desperfectos y es peligroso su uso, así pues Solanye seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Solanye is 21 years old and lives in the city of Ica, within the Parcona district, along with her parents and siblings. [She] is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who puts forth all of her efforts to get ahead.

Unfortunately she was not able to study for a management career due to lack of resources and the need to go to work to help her parents, but she would have liked to do it.  She likes to watch movies in her spare time and sometimes likes to cook a delicious roasted chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Solanye works providing cleaning, washing, and other services for about ten hours a day.  She believes that things are going well for us because of the friendly treatment she gives others.

Solanye is very grateful to the Kiva investors because their help will make it possible for her to buy her stove, which will be very useful to her because she currently cooks with kerosene which is not perfect and is dangerous to use.  In this way Solanye will continue to work and make an effort to achieve her greatest dream of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 38 years old and married with three children currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruvelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Ruvelyn has been in this business for five years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

In the future Ruvelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ascención

texts.es: Maria de 69 años de edad, es una mujer casada madre de 6 hijos en edades adultas. Ella habita al sur de la ciudad, donde comercializa calzado, perfumería, ropa y productos de aseo,  desde el año 1991, cuando se sintió sin hacer nada y queriendo tener su propio dinero para soportar sus gastos, fue haciendo economía domestica de lo que su esposo le daba para el sustento de su familia y reunió su primer capital, para comprar artículos económicos y venderlos a crédito entre sus familiares, vecinos y amigos, que fueron su primer mercado real. En la actualidad vende no solo a crédito, sino también de contado, durante todos los días e inicia su actividad desde la 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza de contado en el país vecino y en almacenes ubicados en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Maria ha recibido 3 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado adecuar su infraestructura con vitrinas, y surtirlas, para impactar a su clientela y despertar en ella su atención, interés deseo y acción de compra de sus productos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, cada vez mas, por eso está atenta de obtener créditos, para aportarle a su capital de trabajo y aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará suéteres, calzado, jeans, perfumería, útiles de aseo personal, entre otros artículos de mayor rotación, que le proporcionan ingresos inmediatos, y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa
texts.en:
Maria, 69 years old, is a married woman who is the mother of six adult children. She lives in the south of the city, where she sells footwear, perfumes, clothes, and personal cleaning products. She began in 1991, when she felt that she was not doing anything and wanted to have her own money to pay her expenses.
