texts.es: Negociantes es un grupo que tiene 5 ciclos con su crédito, esta integrado por 6 mujeres muy trabajadoras que desean sacar adelante a sus familias. Le pusieron al grupo Negociantes porque todas tenían negocios diferentes. Noemí es una persona responsable, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos casados de 30 y 26 años; ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repostería desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, menciona que le gusta mucho realizar pasteles, galletas, etc., todo lo realiza en su casa y con este crédito invertirá en artículos para realizar unos pedidos que tiene pendientes. Nos menciona que se quiere asociar con otra integrante del grupo, para así construir en una misma casa un cuarto especial para su negocio y levantar pedidos mas grandes. Noemí es voluntaria en la iglesia de la colonia y cuando hay kermes o ferias también pone su mercancía a la venta en los mismos.
texts.en:
Negociantes is a group that has gone through five loan cycles. It is composed of six women who are very hard working and want to help their families get ahead. They named the group, Negociantes (Businesswomen) because they have a variety of different businesses.

Noemi is a responsible person. She is married and has two married children, who are 30 and 26 years of age. She is a merchant and has been selling pastries for approximately 20 years. She notes that she greatly enjoys making cakes, cookies, etc. She makes all of them at her house. She will invest this loan in ingredients to fill some orders that she has pending. She tells us that she wants to partner with another member of the group in order to build a special room in one of their houses so that she can fill larger orders. 

Noemi volunteers at a church in the town and when there are fairs and markets she also puts her merchandise on sale there.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients to make pastries (flour, sugar, eggs, pots, etc.)

loans.name: Queenie

texts.en:
Queenie lives in Ugad, in the northern area of Cabagan.  She is a 38-year-old married woman with 4 children.  She is engaged in selling different products in the community.  She works hard to provide for the needs of her children. 

She is requesting 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, drinks, spices, and commodities.  She dreams that she can expand her business to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, spices and commodities.

loans.name: Marcia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad, dar una buena atención a sus clientes con un ambiente cómodo y familiar es la meta de Marcia, de 48 años de edad,  originaria  de León, madre de 3 hijos, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace veinte años, aunque su nivel académico es hasta el cuarto grado de primaria
Marcia  inicio su   actividad por iniciativa propia, quería ser una persona independiente, su hija la apoya en el negocio pues le ayudan en la administración del negocio, se siente satisfecha en el lugar donde se encuentra pues la demanda es mucha, es un negocio rentable, cuenta con clientes fijos y genera ingresos diarios pero eso no satisface las expectativas de Marcia pues su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes para que se sienta en un ambiente cómodo.
Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne, pollo, huevo, mostaza, queso, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a  comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de su deliciosa comida. Sus planes futuros es diversificarse en productos, aumentar su clientela, obtener más ingresos y llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciantes.
texts.en:
To offer fresh, quality products, to give good service to her clients in a comfortable and warm environment is Marcia's goal. She is 48 years old, a native of León, and the mother of three children. She is a vendor by trade, selling food for twenty years, although she has a fourth grade education.

Marcia began her business on her own. She wanted to be an independent person. Her daughter supports her in the business by helping her run it. She feels satisfied in the place where she is, as there is a great deal of demand, her business is profitable, she has regular customers, and she generates daily income, but that doesn't satisfy Marcia's expectations. Her hope is to offer a better service to her customers so that they feel that they are in a comfortable environment.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, beef, chicken, eggs, mustard, cheese, etc. She believes that this loan will help her to buy all the ingredients she needs to make her delicious food. Her future plans are to diversify her products, increase her clientele, earn more income, and become one of the best vendors.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, meat, chicken, egg, mustard, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Gemma works hard to support her family.  She sells rice grains in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables and farming.  Gemma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Gemma has been sustaining her business through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Laou-Rou Group

texts.fr: LAOU-ROU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Epiphanie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo, est âgée de 61 ans est veuve avec six enfants, dont quatre à sa charge et certains scolarisés. Epiphanie a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Epiphanie vit seule avec ses enfants. Epiphanie assure  seule les différentes charges de la maison. Epiphanie vend du maïs, de l’huile et es divers( savons, sucre, lait) à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution. Epiphanie s’approvisionne dans les régions du Bénin.  Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Epiphanie et les autres membres du groupe LAOU-ROU sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé  en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Laou-Rou is a group composed of three women who are friends. The group’s representative, Epiphanie, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 61 years old and a widow with six children, four of whom are still in her care and some of whom are in school. Epiphanie left school at the secondary level. She lives alone with her children. Epiphanie provides for household needs on her own. She sells corn, vegetable oil and various items (soap, sugar, milk, etc) out of her home and through a distribution system. She stocks up in different regions of Benin. Thanks to this business, she manages to support herself and her children. Epiphanie and the other members of the Laou-Rou group are seeking financial support from ALIDé for the second time, in order to bolster their working capital and their businesses and better respond to customer demand. Their prior [loan] has been duly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetable oil and various items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams that her business will get bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and  she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo works hard to support his family. He is single and has a vending business in the Philippines selling fruit, vegetables and spices. He has been in this business for eight years.

Zosimo requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fruit, vegetables, and spices to sell in his stand.

In the future, Zosimo would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, vegetables, and spices to sell in his stand

loans.name: Liupapa

texts.en:
Liupapa is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Liupapa has requested a loan to help her buy ingredients for her popcorn business. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's living conditions. Liupapa has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, cooking oil, and salt

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Naomi has operated a fish selling business, selling from her home to neighbors and town dwellers. Seasonality is a major challenge that she faces in this business.

Naomi is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish and establish a green grocery store. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and establish a green grocery store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro cuenta con 42 años de edad, es el segundo de 5 hermanos, nació en el municipio de Dr. Arroyo,  en el sur del estado de Nuevo León, México. Cuando él tenía 11 años, sus papás que eran agricultores, emigraron a esta ciudad de Monterrey, buscado mejores oportunidades de vida que le permitieran sacar adelante a su numerosa familia. 
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres, Pedro terminó la secundaria y ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios por la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a sus papás con el gasto familiar. A sus 15 años inició como ayudante de soldador en un taller de soldadura, permaneciendo en ese trabajo por 5 años, período en el que aprendió la profesión de soldador.  Fue entonces cuando decidió instalar un pequeño taller de soldadura para realizar trabajos solicitados por sus vecinos y alrededores.  Tiempo después, tuvo que contratar a un ayudante para hacerle frente a la demanda de los trabajos solicitados. 

Actualmente cuenta con la mano de obra de tres (3) ayudantes que utiliza para cumplir  con varios proyectos requeridos de algunas constructoras, pero le hacen falta los materiales necesarios para concluir dichos proyectos, por lo que solicitó un crédito con la esperanza de que le sea otorgado y pueda adquirir esos materiales, y obtener buenas utilidades.

Pedro vive con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su mamá, que quedó viuda hace varios años y su mayor compromiso es seguir ayudando a su familia y a sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old. He is the second of five brothers and was born in the town of Dr. Arroyo in the south of the state of Nuevo León, México. When he was 11 years old, his parents, who were farmers, emigrated to the city of Monterrey in search of better life opportunities that would allow them to provide for their large family.

With his parents' effort, Pedro finished high school; he wasn't able to continue his education because he needed to work and help his parents with household costs. When he was 15 years old, he started as a welder's helper in a welding shop. He remained in that job for five years, a period during which he learned the welding profession. It was then that he decided to set up a small welding shop to do jobs on request for his neighbors and the people in the area. A while later, he had to hire a helper to keep up with the demand of the requested work. 

Pedro currently relies on the work of three helpers whom he uses to complete various projects required by builders, but he lacks the necessary materials to finish those projects. So he is requesting a loan with the hope that it will be granted so that he can acquire those materials and make good use of them.  

Pedro lives with his wife, his two children, and his mom, who was widowed several years ago. His greatest commitment is to continue helping his family and his employees.

loans.use: to acquire materials for his business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is from the village of Guam. She generates income through her sari-sari (convenience store) business. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She has been running her sari-sari business for two years, and earns about PHP 250 daily.

At this time, Rowena is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items including canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits, and condiments to sell. By increasing her store's supplies, she hopes that she will increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items including canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Josie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her last 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Akata

texts.en:
Akata is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Akata has requested a loan to purchase new equipment to improve her plantation.

loans.use: to purchase a shovel, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and weed eater

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is 47 years old, married, and has 7 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community, and has been doing this for three years.

Maselina has requested a loan to buy spears and other tools for her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maselina will save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: purchase fishing gear, fishing nets, and spears

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional clothes for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She wants to borrow 10,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy foods and household goods to sell, such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, and shampoo, for her general store business. Gemma has been working in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy foods and household goods to sell, such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and shampoo.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a 43-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has four children between the ages of 10 and 18. She has operated a sari-sari (convenience store) business for fifteen years. This is the source of her income.

Maria Luz is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, soft drinks, flour, sugar, and oil to sell in her store.

Maria Luz hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, soft drinks, flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou is 30 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community, and has been doing this for two years.

Sou has requested a loan to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sou will make improvements to her home and help her children attend school.

loans.use: purchase flour, salt, pork, and cooking oil

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is married with seven children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water.

She operates an open air food business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the near future. 

With this loan, Raheli will purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Akpa-Glo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPA-GLO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ayaba Enyonan, est âgée 28 ans. Ayaba Enyonan est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Ayaba Enyonan est célibataire sans enfants. Ayaba Enyonan n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Enyonan vend des friperies depuis cinq ans ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille.Ayaba Enyonan s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Ayaba Enyonan désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Ayaba Enyonan sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPA-GLO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Akpa-glo group consists of three persons who are friends. The representative of this group, Ayaba Enyonan, is 28 years old. She is the one whose hand is raised on the photo.

Ayaba Enyonan is single without children. She did not attend school. She has been selling second-hand clothing for the past five years which enables her to respond without difficulties to her family's needs. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to better serve her customers, Ayaba Enyonan wants to strengthen her business. To do so, she is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, together with other members of the Akpa-glo group.

loans.use: Buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 39-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation, and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Nora has asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and equipment for her farming business, including a wheel barrow, shovels, and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Nora hopes to save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy equipment and fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. Judith makes a living through the direct selling business. She has been doing this for one year, and usually earns about 1,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) a week. 

Judith needs additional funds. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy powder, lotion, cologne and deodorant to offer for sale in her village. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy powder, lotion, cologne and deodorant to offer for sale in her village

loans.name: Ledivina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ledivina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Ledivina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Ledivina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from the village of Guam. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. To provide for her family, she became involved in the retail business. She has been in this business for five years, and makes about PHP 300 daily. 

Josephine dreams of lifting her children from poverty, which is why she works hard in her business. To this end, Josephine is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more products for her store, such as condiments, assorted breads, beverages and noodles. 

She hopes to grow her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: purchase items such as condiments, assorted breads, beverages, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Hermenigilda

texts.en:
Hermenigilda is 39 years old, and married with three children.

She earns a living through pig husbandry in the Philippines. Hermenigilda would like to borrow 23,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy food and vitamins for her pigs.

Hermenigilda has been in pig husbandry for 10 years. She also earns additional income from tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly to reach her dream, which is to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy food and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To plough the land, and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 31 years old, single and operates a direct selling business in her village. She sells cosmetics and perfumes. Ana Marie is very patient in offering these products in order to gain income. She usually makes about 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) each month, and it goes on meals, bills at home and revolving capital in the business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy colognes, soap, shampoo, and perfumes to sell. 

In the future, Ana Marie hopes to keep offering good products and services to her customers, to make her business profitable to earn more income for family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy colognes, soap, shampoo, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, shovels, and bush knives

loans.name: Gulshoda

texts.ru: Гулшода 23-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее один ребёнок. Она живет в районе Рудаки, который находится в западной части Таджикистана. Гулшода швея, она уже год работает в этой области. Она шьет национальные женские платья у себя дома. Гулшода запрашивает кредит для покупки швейной машины (модели Yamata - это вышивочная швейная машинка, с помощью которой она сможет сделать вышивку для материалов на заказ), и необходимых тканей, чтобы сшить национальные платья для продажи.
texts.en: Gulshoda is 23 years old, married, and has 1 child. She lives in the western part of Tajikistan in the Rudaki region. She is a seamstress and has been working in this field for a year now. She works from home sewing national-style dresses for women. She is seeking a loan to buy the fabrics she needs to make these dresses to sell, and to purchase a Yamata sewing machine with a special embroidering feature that will allow her to provide embroidery services for clients.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Epi

texts.en: Epi is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taro, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Epi has requested a loan to buy spades, weed killer, weed spray, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and baby taro. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Epi hopes to improve her business to help her family.

loans.use: to buy spades, weed killer, chemicals, bush knives, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She has a place to sew where many people come every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as sewing machine needles and thread. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Olivia independent because she can be responsible for herself, and she can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine needles and thread.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Jagna, Bohol. Mercy has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. Mercy is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed for her pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is 41 years old, is married to a carpenter, and has three children. She is a small entrepreneur selling frozen meat products such as hot dogs, sausages, and eggs to the people in her village. Precy hopes to keep selling more products for added income and to sustain the education needs of her children. She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy more hot dogs, sausages, and eggs to sell. 
Precy hopes to keep improving her income to earn more funds. She will be very happy to see all her children have good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs, sausages, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил занимается ремонтами «под ключ». Всегда выполняет ремонтные работы только качественно и на высшем уровне, вследствие чего потенциальные клиенты даже становятся к нему в очередь за 6 месяцев вперед. В основном он устанавливает системы отопления, подвесные потолки, декорирует стены, кладет плитку и проводит электрику.  Всегда умеет воссоздать оригинальный дизайн комнат. 
Михаил давно собирался сделать ремонт в своем собственном доме. Сейчас наконец-то выдалось время для этого. Он надеется вложить 20 000 гривен, полученных от КИВА, в косметический ремонт у себя. Более того Михаил планирует также переделать отопление в доме.
texts.en: Michael does home repairs for a living on a turnkey contract basis. He always provides high-quality workmanship, and as a result, he has a list of potential clients who are on a 6-month waiting list for his services. He mainly installs heating systems and suspended ceilings, decorates walls, lays tiles, and does electrical wiring. He is always able to create an original room design. Mikhail has been wanting to renovate his own home for a long time now, and the time has finally come to do it. He is seeking a loan from Kiva in the amount of 20,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya which he will invest in this redecorating project. He also plans to re-do the heating system in his home.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment

loans.name: Maria

texts.ru:
Мария смогла успешно и быстро реализовать предыдущую партию товара, так как продажи продуктов питания всегда стабильные, да и на кондитерские изделия всегда есть спрос. Увеличив свой доход Мария смогла сделать ремонт в квартире. А еще совсем недавно у Марии родился внук. 
Мария обратилась за суммой в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить конфеты, печенье и другие сладости под реализацию. Имея большой выбор товаров, Мария сможет тем самым увеличить свой доход еще больше.
texts.en: Maria was able to successfully and quickly sell her previous inventory because grocery sales are always steady, and there is always big demand for sweets. Having increased her income, Maria was able to carry out renovations in her apartment. Very recently, Maria became a grandmother. She is now seeking a loan of 21,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to purchase candy, cookies, and other sweets to sell. Having a large selection of goods will allow her to increase her income even more.

loans.use: to purchase candy, cookies, and other sweets to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда использовала предыдущий кредит для того, чтобы пополнить ассортимент товара и увеличить продажи, а, значит, улучшить условия проживания для своей семьи. 
В этот раз Надежде необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар, а именно мужское белье, а также носки, колготки и шлепанцы.
texts.en: Nadezhda used her previous loan to expand the range of goods she offers to increase her sales, which led to an improvement in the living conditions of her family. This time, she is needs a loan of 10,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to purchase goods to sell, specifically, men's underwear, socks, nylons, and flip flops.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, specifically men's underwear, socks, nylons, and flip flops

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
За счет предыдущих кредитом от КИВА Сильвия смогла постепенно увеличить свой доход от продаж благодаря увеличению предложенного выбора товара, прибавилось и постоянных клиентов.
В этот раз Сильвия обратилась к КИВА за кредитом в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар: женские весенние блузки, платья и юбки. К лету темпы торговли слабеют и приходиться вкладывать больше средств, чтобы заработать как раньше. За счет полученной прибыли Сильвия надеется продолжить начатый ремонт дома, который так давно хочет закончить.
texts.en: Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Silviya was able to gradually increase her income from sales due to the expansion of the assortment of goods she sells, which has allowed her to gain more regular clients. This time, she has approached Kiva for a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to purchase seasonal clothing such as women's spring blouses, dresses, and skirts. Towards summer, there is a drop-off in retail sales, and it becomes necessary to invest more in order to make the same income as before. Silviya hopes to use the profit generated by this loan to continue the home renovation that she has already started, and that she has long wanted to complete.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing such as women's spring blouses, dresses, and skirts

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 36 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora con muchas fuerzas y deseos de superarse, casada y de ella dependen 5 hijos de los cuales viven en casa y estudian en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa y no pudo seguir estudiando en la secundaria por falta de ayuda económica por parte de sus padres ya que ellos son de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura desde muy joven en la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos como ser arroz, maíz y frijol. En compañía de su esposo y de sus hijos cuando salen de sus actividades escolares ellos colaboran con la limpieza y desgrane a su temprana edad. Las tierras que ella junto a su familia trabajan no son propias por lo cual pagan un alquiler y eso les deja menos ganancia sobre su producto al final de cada cosecha. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona donde ella habita el cual tiene mejor venta los fines de semana ya que ella aprovecha las ferias en los mercados como también en los alrededores con los vecinos y zonas aledañas.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada para poder cultivar un poco más en su propiedad que ella y su esposo alquilan ya que quiere aprovechar al máximo un espacio libre y darle uso al mismo.

Su meta es son de poder con el tiempo comprar una parcela de tierra la cual le permita cultivar de manera propia ya que el trabajo es duro y pesado y en ocasiones arriesgado por algunos desastres naturales o plagas que dañan sus cultivos y siempre tienen que pagar el alquiler de la propiedad. Sus sueños son de poder educar a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores ingresos en el futuro y no pasen por los desafíos y trabas que ellos en su juventud ya que el trabajo de la agricultura es pesado y cansado.
texts.en:
Nelly, 36 years old, is a plucky and enterprising woman with a lot of strength and desire to move ahead in life.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are dependent on Nelly as they are at various stages in their education.  Nelly herself completed primary school bu could not continue to secondary school due to a lack of financial help from her parents, who had very little money.  It was Nelly's parents who, from a very young age, taught her agriculture and how to grow basic grains such as rice, corn and beans.  With her husband and her children (after they have finished school), the family go out to clean and shell the crops at a young age.  Nelly does not own the land she works, but rents it.  This leaves her with a lower profit on the final product at every harvest.  She sells her products in the local area and sells more at the weekends.  She takes advantage of the markets and also the area around her home, selling to neighbours and in the adjoining areas.

Nelly is currently applying for help to buy certified seeds in order to grow a little more on the land that she and her husband rent.  She wants to take full advantage of the free space and use it up.

Nelly's goal is, in time, to buy a plot of land that will allow her to grow her crops on her own.  The work is hard and sometimes risky because of natural disasters or plagues the damage the crops, but they still always have to pay rent for the land.  Nelly's dream is to educate her children so that they have a better quality of life, a higher income in the future and so that they do not have to face the same challenges and obstacles she did in her youth, as agricultural work is difficult and tiring.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds for her corn, bean and rice crops.

loans.name: Teresa  De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa  una humilde  comerciante, de 53 años de edad, originaria de la  Comarca Larreynaga, en las afueras de  León, soltera, madre de 1 hijos de 12 años, actualmente estudia, Teresa es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace mas de  de 20 años, debido a sus condiciones económica solo logro finalizar su cuarto grado de primaria. 
Inicio en el ámbito del comercio hace 33 años, ya que miro que en donde ella vivía no había Pulperías cercas y fue allí que se le vino a la idea de emprender su propio negocio, la cual miro que le iba a generar mejores ingresos, debido a que no habían negocio para que le hicieran competencia, este ha sido su primer negocio,  no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, sus productos lo comercializa en su casa de habitación.
Hoy en día Teresa   quiere invertir en su pulpería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos variados y obtener mejores ganancias. 
Esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, leche, carne, pollo, cloro, etc. Todos los productos  necesario que aun no tiene en existencia, ella estima que este crédito le será de ayuda porque podrá surtir su negocio para mayor atracción de su clientela, de esta manera incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos, una de sus metas próximas es poder cancelar este crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro y poder sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a poor business woman.  Shee is 53 years old and originally from Comarca Larreynaga, on the outskirts of León.  She is single and a mother to her 12 year old son who is in school.  Teresa has a grocery store, which she has owned for more than 20 years.  Due to financial circumstances, Teresa was only ever able to complete up to fourth grade of primary school.

Teresa started working in business 33 years old. Where she lived there were no grocery stores nearby and so the idea of starting her own business came to her.  She saw that she would earn a higher income as she had no competition.  This was Teresa's first business and she did not have anybody's support.  She sold her products out of a room in her home.

Today Teresa wants to invest in her grocery store so she can offer a variety of products to her customers and earn a higher income.

She is applying for a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, milk, meat, chicken, chlorine and more.  These are the products she needs as she does not stock them.  Teresa thinks the loan will be of great help because she will be able to stock up her business and attract customers.  Thus she will increase her sales and, therefore, her income.  One of her short-term goals is to pay off the loan so that she can apply for another and to help her son do well in life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, milk, meat, chicken, chlorine and more.

loans.name: Nohelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nohelia de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la producción arepas, desde hace más de 15 años, actividad que se ha constituido es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus cuatro hijos. Por su condición de madre soltera, esta mujer debe ocuparse de generar los ingresos necesarios para la alimentación, vivienda y educación de su familia. Razón por la cual decidió subemplearse y estar pendiente del cuidado de sus hijos. 
Su mayor deseo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la construcción de un nuevo fogón de carbón, con parrilla metálica y mejoramiento de la chimenea, con el propósito de aumentar su producción y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nohelia is 50 years old and makes a living making corn pancakes.  She has been doing this for over 15 years and this has been the income source that has supported her four children.  Given that she is a single mother, Nohelia must earn the necessary money to provide food, shelter and an education for her family. Nohelia is underemployed, though, so that she can look after her children.

Nohelia's biggest dream is to improve her quality of life at home, which is why she is applying for a loan that she will use to build a new coal stove with a metal grill and to improve the chimney.  This will allow her to increase her production and her income.

loans.use: to build a new coal stove with a metal grill and improve the chimney.

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is 23 years old and married with two children.

Gretchen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods like eggs, soft drinks, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Gretchen has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from direct selling of Natasha products.

Gretchen aspires to save enough money to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods like eggs, soft drinks, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is an 18 year old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Esther needs a loan to buy foam cups, sugar, flavor mix, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Esther has been a member of SPBD starting this year.

loans.use: sugar, flavor mix and foam cups

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a 45 year old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has 4 children. The youngest child is 8 while the oldest is 21. She is engaged in the fishing business.  Her husband is the one  who catches the fish while Merlyn sells them to nearby towns. She and her husband have been doing this for more than 10 years.  She requested a loan of PHP 12,000  to buy fish nets, epoxy (water based acrylic epoxy paint) and paint. In the future, Merlyn would like to expand her business to support her family at the same time be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish nets , epoxy (water based acrylic epoxy paint) and paint.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and married with eight children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items like shampoo, soap, egg, noodles, spices, etc. to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Letecia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like shampoo, soap, egg, noodles and spices to sell

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is a vegetable farmer from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children. Annalou helps her husband in tending their farm.
Annalou is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and its harvest thus giving them more produce to sell at the market. Annalou hopes to expand their farm and save money for the future schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en:
Phelister is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Phelister dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Juana  es cliente Kiva, de 63 años de edad, una humilde señora originaria de León, casada, madre de 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ella  se siente muy satisfecha porque su primer créditos Kiva le fue de gran ayuda porque pudo surtir mas su venta, comprando ropa mas demandada por sus clientes como blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, asesorios para dama, etc.
Es por eso que hoy en día Juana esta solicitando su segundo financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en lo misma compra de  ropa como blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, short, calcetines, toallas. Con el objetivo de incrementar más sus ventas  y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is a Kiva borrower. She is 63 years old. A humble lady originally from  León, she is married, and the mother of 4 children, all adults. She works as a merchant, selling clothing.

She is very happy because her first Kiva loan was a big help because she could supply her sales stock, buying the clothing most in demand by her customers such as blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, accessories for women, etc.

This is why today Juana is asking for her second loan in order to continue investing in the same way buying clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, socks, and towels. Her objective is to increase her sales and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, shorts, socks and towels

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: La nueva Alcancía Comunal  “Señor Del Rimac”  está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa. Una de las socias es Janet de 32 años  casada con 02 menores hijos. Janet se dedica a la siembra y venta de flores como la gran mayoría de la gente que habitan  esas zonas. Este negocio le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera apoyar a hijos en su educación.  Su mayor deseo es de poner un puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus flores. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de semillas. El nuevo grupo “Señor Del Rimac” agradece el crédito brindado. Janet es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo turquesa y lleva cargada a su bebe en su espalda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Señor Del Rimac is made up of 6 women entrepreneurs and enthusiasts beginning to work with the program.

One of the members is Janet. She is married, 32 years old, with 2 young children. Janet works growing and selling flowers as most people do who live in these areas.This business has permitted her to increase her income and this is the way she supports her children with their education. Her biggest desire is to open her own stand where she can sell her flowers. The requested loan will be used to buy seeds. 

The new group Señor Del Rimac is grateful for the credit provided.

Janet is the second from the right side and wearing a turquoise polo and carrying a baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow for her flower selling business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida.
Victor tiene 5 años de haber establecido un negocio de pulperia.Vende productos de la canasta basica familiar como ser, harina, frijoles, arroz, manteca, azucar, lacteos, carnes, productos de limpieza etc. el negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar que tiene bastante afluencia de personas,las ventas son a diario y tiene su propia clientela. El para mantener mas surtido el negocio solicito un prestamo a Odef, de 21000 lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios que tienen mayor demanda como frijoles, harina, manteca, arroz, etc. Esta inversion le ayudara mucho para seguir dandole el servicio a los clientes.La meta es mantener  su negocio bien surtido con los productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Victor is 37 years old, single and lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida. 

Victor opened a grocery store 5 years ago. He sells basic household items such as flour, beans, rice, butter, sugar, dairy products, meat, cleaning supplies, etc. The business is located in a place with a good flow of people, and he makes daily sales having his own regular customers.

In order to maintain the stock for the business he is asking for a loan from ODEF, of 21000 lempiras in order to buy food products that are most in demand such as beans, flour, butter, rice, etc. This investment will help a lot so he can continue providing service to his customers. His goal is to keep his store well supplied with the necessary stock.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as: rice, beans, flour, butter, etc. in order to supply his business

loans.name: Ashurkhon

texts.ru: Ашурхон 64 лет. Она вдова и имеет 7 детей. Несмотря на свой возраст, она очень энергичная и старается все больше зарабатывать деньги. Все ее дети взрослые и имеют своих дел. Двое ее сыновей работают разнорабочими в Российской Федерации. Ашурхон более 1 года занимается купле продажей топлива. Двое дочери Ашурхон помогают ей введение бизнеса. Ашурхон использует свой доход для улучшения условия проживания своих детей и внуков. Она хочет развивать бизнес дальше и таким образом получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует дать в наследство приданное своим внуком. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки топлива для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ashurkhon is 64 years old. She is a widow and has seven children. Despite her age, she is very energetic and tries to earn even more money. All her children are adults and have their own lives. Two of her sons are general workers in the Russian Federation. 

Ashurkhon has for more than a year worked with buying and reselling fuel. Two of her daughters help her in managing the business. Ashurkhon spends her income on improving the living conditions of her children and grandchildren. She would like to develop her business further and this way receive a larger income. With the income received she plans to provide an inheritance to her grandchildren. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of fuel to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for reselling, and hereby increasing her working capital

loans.name: June

texts.en: June is 24 years old. She is married and has no children. She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas and yams that she sells in her community and at the market. She has had this business for 3 years. June needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, weed killer, bush knives and other equipment to help her improve her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. June will use the profits from her sales to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, weed killer and bush knives.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a photography business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vehicle transport. Helen is borrowing PHP22,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her photography business. Helen successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her photography business.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ambrosia  es integrante del Grupo Shalom

La Sra. Ambrosia tiene un restaurante en su casa, es un  negocio familiar porque  todos participan realizando  diferentes labores, como la preparación de la comida y la atención al público. En su negocio vende comida rápida como hamburguesas, pollo broaster y bebidas. Gracias a su trabajo solventa los estudios de sus hijos, quienes desean continuar con el negocio en el futuro, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá  para la compra de  mesas y sillas para su restaurante, en un futuro le gustaría que sus hijos puedan abrir otras  sucursales de su restaurante en otros lugares, espera poder seguir con EDAPROSPO  para lograr los proyectos que tiene.
La Sra. Ambrosia  agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA  por el apoyo.
En la foto es la ultima de la izquierda viste polo color naranja
texts.en:
Ambrosia is a member of the loan group Shalom.
Ambrosia has a restaurant in her house. It is a family business because everybody takes part doing different work such as preparing the food and serving the public. In her business, she sells fast food such as hamburgers, chicken, and drinks. Thanks to her work, she can pay for her children's studies. The children want to continue with the business in the future. The loan that she has requested will be used to buy more tables and chairs for her restaurant. In the future, she would like for her children to open other branches of her restaurant in other locations. She hopes to be able to keep working with EDAPROSPO to achieve her projects. 
Ambrosia is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help. 
In the photo, she is the last one on the rich in an orange shirt.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Berta Lidia

texts.es:
Berta tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y viven con su familia en San Juan Pueblo.
Doña Berta tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos, las cuales realiza de manera ambulante. ofrece polvos para la  cara, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, maquillajes, etc.lleva trabajando con este negocio 4 años y manifiesta que le ha ido bien tiene sus propios clientes. Con este prestamo que solicita es el cuarto con Odef de 8000 lempiras los cuales destinara para comprar mas mercaderia como, maquillaje, polvos faciales, perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo etc. Esta inversion le ayuda mucho ya que suplira los pedidos pendientes a los clientes y poder tener los ingresos necesarios. Su meta es ayudar siempre sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
34 year old Berta is married, has four children, and lives with her family in San Juan Pueblo.
Berta has a business selling cosmetics, which she does from door to door. She offers face powder, lotions, creams, deodorants, makeup, etc. She has been working at this business for 4 years and says that it has gone well and she has her own customers. The loan that she is requesting is her fourth from Odef and is for $425 which she will use to buy more merchandise such as makeup, face powder, perfumes, body creams, etc. This investment will help her a lot as she will be able to meet her customers' orders and have the necessary income. Her goal is to always help her children and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as makeup, face powder, body creams, perfumes, etc, to supply her store.

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.ru:
Любовь – предприниматель-сельскохозяйственник из Гладковки. Она 15 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 34 сотках земли выращивает огурца, помидоры и перец. 
Любови понадобилась дополнительная сумма в размере 20 000 гривен для того покрыть содержание своего тепличного хозяйства, а именно чтобы подготовить теплицы к сезону, а именно купить семена, пленку, дрова и провести необходимую реконструкцию теплиц. Любовь хотела бы заниматься этим делом и дальше, по возможности расширяя свое дело.
texts.en:
Lyubov is an agriculture entrepreneur from Gladkovka. She has worked with greenhouse farming for fifteen years. She grows cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers on 34 acres of land. 

Lyubov is in need of 20,000 hrvynia in order to cover her greenhouses, and also to prepare them for the season, as well as to purchase seeds, plastic film, firewood and to carry out necessary reconstruction of the greenhouses. Lyubov would like to do pursue this business further, and if possible expand it.

loans.use: to prepare the greenhouses for the season, and also to purchase seeds, plastic film, firewood and carry out necessary reparation of the greenhouses

loans.name: Any Corina

texts.es:
Any tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Any se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de productos de bisuteria como ser, aretes, cadenas, aritos, etc. tiene 10 años haciendo esta actividad en la cual comenta esta contenta aparte de que es un arte que ella misma diseña.Tiene su propia clientela y las ganancias han sido rentables.Lleva 4 creditos con Odef los cuales le han ayudado mucho en mantener el negocio.Actualmente el que solicita es de 10000 lempiras para comprar materiales como jade, perlas, piedras de colores, mostacillas etc. para hacer las prendas. Con esta inversion piensa que aumentara sus ventas ya que tendra el material necesario para hacer diferentes diseños y ofrecer a los clientes.En un futuro ella desea tener su propio local donde poder exibir mejor el producto.
texts.en:
Any is 35 years old and lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Any makes a living making a selling items of costume jewellery, such as earrings, chains, rings and more.  She has been doing this work for ten years and she tells us that she is happy with it and that she herself designs the jewellery.  Any has a good customer base and the business has been profitable  She has had four loans with ODEF, which have helped her to keep the business afloat.  She is currently applying for 10,000 Lempira to buy materials such as jade, pearl, coloured stones, bead necklaces and more, to make the jewellery items.  With this investment Any thinks she will increase her sales as she will have the material that she needs to make different designs to offer to customers.  In the future she would like to have her own premises where she can better display her products.

loans.use: to buy materials such as jade, pearl, coloured stones, bead necklaces and more, to make the jewellery items.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна – из Виноградово. Она торгует косметикой уже 2 года. Своей торговой точки пока нет, поэтому она арендует торговое помещение. Наемных работников у нее нет. Татьяна – замужем, у нее дочь 4 лет. Татьяна любит выращивать цветы. 
Татьяна обратилась к КИВА за дополнительной финансовой помощью для того, чтобы приобрести партию парфюмерных изделий на 10 000 гривен, а именно женские и мужские духи, чтобы разнообразить ассортимент своего товара на точке. Со временем хочет расшириться и открыть еще одну точку продаж.
texts.en:
Tatyana is from Vinogradovo. She has been selling cosmetics for two years already. She does not yet have her own point of sales, and therefore she rents a selling space. She does not have any employees yet. 

Tatyana is married and has a four year old daughter. Tatyana loves to grow flowers. She turned to Kiva for financial support in order to purchase a batch of perfume products for 10,000 hryvnia, namely women's and men's fragrances, in order to broaden the assortment of goods at the store. Currently she wants to expand and open another point of sales.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of perfume products, namely women's and men's fragrances

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина живет в Дрогобыче в западной части Украины. Она работает в школе, у нее стабильная зарплата. Галина – культурный, ответственный человек, у нее двое детей. 
Сумма в 5 000 гривен необходима Галине для личных целей, а именно для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в кухне. Она планирует сделать новый пол, положить плитку и покрасить стены.
texts.en:
Galina lives in Drogobych in the western part of Ukraine. She works at a school and has a stable income. Galina is a cultured and responsible person. She has two children. 

The 5,000 hryvnia are necessary for Galina for personal reasons, namely in order to refurbish her kitchen. She plans to put in a new floor, install tiles and paint the walls.

loans.use: to refurbish her kitchen

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer de un carisma contagiante y muchas ganas de surgir, tiene 57 años pero tiene el optimismo de una joven de 25 años. Graciela vive en la ciudad Costera de Pisco, caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, sus atractivos turísticos y su gastronomía variada. Graciela es madre de 3 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por las cuales daría su vida por brindarle una vida digna y llena de amor.

Día a día Graciela en su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatillas, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 12 clientes diariamente, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene productos muy bonitos y novedosos.

Graciela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un pequeño local para su negocio, ya que actualmente tiene que alquilarlo; así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos ya que tendrá un local propio y así podrá seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder comprar un carro para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Graciela is a woman with contagious charisma and a great will to succeed. She is 57 years old but has the optimism of a 25 year old. Graciela lives in the city of Costera de Pisco, characterized by its beautiful beaches, its tourist attractions, and its varied gastronomy. Graciela is the mother of 3 children who she loves very much and so she has given her life to offering them a dignified life, full of love. 
Day in and day out, Graciela works in her little store selling shoes. She works around 9 hours a day and can serve up to 12 customers a day. She believes that she is doing well because she is very friendly to the clients and has new and good looking products. 
Graciela is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support that they have offered her, she can buy a small store for her business (she currently rents one). In this way, she will be able to improve her income as she will have her own premises and so she will be able to keep fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: to give her children a profession and to be able to buy a van for her business.

loans.use: to buy premises.

loans.name: Erika Siomara

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 22 años de edad en un estado civil (unión libre) que de su hogar tiene 2 hijos los cuales la mayor tiene 5 años y está por entrar a su primer año de educación primaria y el menor de 16 meses de nacido. Junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura especialmente en el cultivo y siembra de café, actividad que realiza desde su juventud ya que su familia se dedica a esta actividad desde tiempos. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la agricultura misma actividad que hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completada cursada hasta el 5 grado; pero no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos. Actualmente su esposo y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual dependen sus 2 hijos para los cuales tienen muchos planes. 

Erika está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya hongo que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo.  

Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido, las ganancias que quedan son pocas, pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar y fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha y forjar un patrimonio para ellos.
texts.en:
Erika is a 22 year old woman who is in a civil union and has 2 children of which the eldest is 5 years old and is about to enter his first year at elementary school and the youngest is 16 months old. Along with her husband, she works in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of coffee. She has been doing this since her youth as her family have been coffee farmers for a long time. Her parents taught her how to do this work, which she keeps doing today. She studied up to the 5th grade of elementary school but could not keep studying because her parents' income was very low. Currently, she and her husband are mutual support for one another to be successful as their 2 children are dependent on them and they have many plans for them. 
Erika is requesting help to buy fertilizer and fumigation "bombs" to maintain her coffee crop as, if she does not care for the crop, it may be damaged by the rust fungus that particularly affects this sort of crop.
She dreams of raising her two children so that they can have a better quality of life, better employment opportunities (as working the land is very onerous and there is so much environmental contamination and a lack of materials to care for it, and the income is small.) But, in this way she will be able to prepare and strengthen her crop and have an excellent harvest and build a heritage for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fumigacíon "bombs" to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. She is from Ubay, Bohol. Nida is a farmer who has been growing rice for over 20 years. He husband is also a farmer.

Nida is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings to improve her harvest and sell it on time. In the future, she dreams of investing in other business to be successful and save for the future and the coming of old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en:
Vaeluaga is a 63-year-old married woman with four children. For the past two years, she has operated a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas.  Vaeluaga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

Vaeluaga is requesting a loan to buy a shovel, wheelbarrow, and bush knives to improve her plantation. She plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, wheelbarrow, and bush knives

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema now runs three businesses: a farm, a cafe, and a fish-selling business. She is grateful for the support she received with her previous loan and with the progress she has made since receiving her first loan. Neema's business income has improved and enabled her to repay her loan easily and on time. She was also able to buy cattle and will continue dairy farming.

Neema is requesting an 83,450 KES loan to buy flour, cooking fat, cereals and other ingredients for her café. In the future, she hopes to provide a decent education for the seven children in her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking fat, cereals and other ingredients for her café

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Особых изменений со времени получения предыдущего кредита от КИВА у Виталия не было. Однако доход по бизнесу удалось увеличить на 1 500 гривен.  
Виталий в ближайшем будущем собирается ехать за весенней партией товара, для закупки которого ему нужны дополнительные средства, а именно сумма в 21 000 гривен. За счет дополнительных продаж Виталий надеется планомерно увеличивать и свой доход.
texts.en:
There have not been any significant changes for Vitalyi since he received the previous loan from Kiva. However, he was able to increase the income from his business with 1,500 hryvnia. 

Vitalyi has decided to go to get a batch of spring products in the near future. For the purchase he needs additional financial means, of the amount of 21,000 hryvnia. Vitalyi would like to gradually increase his income through additional sales.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of spring products

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Rosa es la presidenta del  grupo “Todo lo puedo en Cristo”

Rosa tiene 55 años, ella es casada vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos. Rosa trabaja brindando servicios de cosmetología maquillaje, peinados, manicure etc. Desde muy joven le apasiono este oficio, para eso estudio  cursos de cosmetología, en la actualidad sus clientas la llaman para prestar sus servicios y es muy requerida sobre todo los fines de semana donde la llaman y separan citas para ser atendidas. Rosa también prepara dulces y pasteles para vender, gracias a su trabajo ayuda a sus hijos con los estudios,  en la actualidad Rosa no cuenta con un lugar para atender a su clientela y le gustaría encontrar uno, con el préstamo solicitado podra comprar materiales para su trabajo como tintes y maquillaje.
Rosa está feliz de pertenecer a su grupo y quiere decir ¡Muchas Gracias!  A los inversores de KIVA 
En la foto viste chompa color verde .
texts.en:
Rosa is the president of the loan group “Todo lo puedo en Cristo”
Rosa is 55 years old, she is married and lives with her husband and their 3 children. Rosa works offering cosmetics services, haircuts, manicures, etc. Since she was very young, she has been passionate about this work so she studied cosmetology. Today, her customers call her for her services and she is in great demand, especially at the weekend when they call and make appointments. Rosa also likes to make desserts and cakes to sell. Thanks to her work, she helps her children with their studies. Currently, Rosa does not have a store where she can serve her customers, and she would like to find one. With the loan that she is requesting, she will be able to buy work materials such as dyes and makeup. 
Rosa is happy to be a member of the loan group and wants to say "thank you very much!" to the Kiva lenders.
She is wearing a green top in the photo.

loans.use: to buy dyes and makeup

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena runs a kiosk that helps generate income for her family. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of 1,500 USD. 

Mena is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy stocks of sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and biscuits to improve her business. She is a hardworking woman and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and biscuits

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest is 9 and the youngest is 7 years old. She operates a sari-sari or variety store. She also raises hogs to supplement the other needs of the family. These are the sources of her income.
Malou is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, food snacks, toiletries, noodles, spices, sugar, coffee, and candies for her sari-sari store. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy what she needs to earn a greater profit.
In the future, Malou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, softdrinks, food snakcs, toiletries, noodles, spices, sugar, coffee, and candies.

loans.name: Giulsanam

texts.en:
Giulsanam is 56 years old. She lives in the Gardabani district with her 26-year-old son,  her daughter in-law, and two grandchildren. The family earns an income from agricultural activities. They cultivate greens and vegetables on a plot of land and sell their harvested products at local markets to earn a small profit which is rarely enough to feed the family. Giulsanam has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up without any success. Her loan request is always rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Giulsanam is requesting a loan from Credo to purchase a cow and a calf. She will milk the cow to make dairy products to sell at the market and increase her family's daily income. Giulsanam will slaughter the calf when it is grown and sell the meat to earn additional income. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Giulsanam's new business initiative, financed with her Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa, who is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In business for 12 years now, she has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her enterprise.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Ella es Esmeralda , se considera una persona integra, responsable, estudiosa, con muchos sueños y metas para su vida.
Quiere trabajr y estudiar para ser una gran profesional para asi poder ayudar a sus familiares y ser un ejemple de superacion.
Quiere tener una estabilidad economica, su mayor anhelo es conocer su pais en todo su esplendor y luego el mundo entero, luego de esto quiere desempeñarse como bailarina. 
Al escoger el area de hoteleria, sabe que se abrira puertas para luchar y correr tras sus sueños, a demas es conciente que debe estudiar idiomas ya que en eso se basa su profesion. 
Sabe que todo esto es con esfuerzo y con pasion, a demas de mucha disciplina, quiere obtener los mejores resultados en sus deberes y no ser derrumbada por andie.
Desea ser millonaria en conocimiento para poder ayudar a aquellos que mas lo necesitan y demostrarse a si misma que todo es posible.
texts.en:
This is Esmeralda. She is known to be a person with integrity, and is responsible, studious, with many dreams and goals for her life.

She wants to work and study in order to become a good professional in order to help her relatives and to be a good example of coming out on top.

She wants to have economic stability. Her greatest longing is to become acquainted with her country in all its splendor and then the entire world, and after that she wants to perform as a dancer. 

Choosing the hospitality industry, she knows to fight and chase her dreams in order to open doors and another thing she is aware of is that she should study languages as this is  customary in her profession.

She knows that all this takes struggle and passion, besides a lot of discipline, and she hopes to obtain the best results in her duties and not be be crushed by anyone.

She wants to think like a millionaire in order to be able to help those that need it most and to prove to herself that anything is possible.

loans.use: to finish her academic studies in the hospitality industry

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.ru:
Александр  - фермер. С 1996 года занимается выращиванием  лука, пшеницы, ячменя, гарчицы и подсолнечника.  
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
В семье Александра есть двое детей 7-ми и 15-ти лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания пшеницы.
Александр решил приобрести капельную ленту для полива .
В планах на будущие: увеличить площадь капельного орошения, т.к в данной местности большие проблемы с водой для полива.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования капельной ленты.
texts.en: Alexandr is a farmer. Since 1996, he has been growing onions, wheat, barley, mustard, and sunflowers. His wife helps him with his work. He has 2 children who are 7 and 15 years old. He started out by growing wheat. He has now decided to purchase drip tape for irrigation. His plans for the future include expanding the area he has under drip tape irrigation, as his current area has big problems with water for irrigating. His personal plans include completing construction of his house. Alexandr needs your help to finance his purchase of drip tape.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been running her business for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling shrimp. Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Lina is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as soap, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, and other items for her store. In the future, she dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, shampoo, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been running a business selling rice and grains in the Philippines. She has been running her business for two years and earns additional income from milling rice, selling fruit, and farming rice. Lydia has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Lydia is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She dreams of saving more money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 34 years old and is married with five children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines. She has borrowed six previous loans through NWTF to sustain her business.

Eden is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and additional livestock for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and additional livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who has three children. She earns a living running a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Teresita is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to buy additional goods such as soda, soap, toiletries, rice, biscuits, and candies. She will use the profit from her loan to improve her inventory and increase her sales by catering to more customers. In the future, Teresita dreams of making her business successful and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soda, soap, toiletries, rice, biscuits, and candies

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
This is Rochelle, 34, who is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a mother of six children and she and her partner share the responsibility of attending to their children and earning an income to provide for their daily needs. Rochelle is a Balut vendor. In the Philippines, Balut is well-known food that is sold on the sidewalk. It is an un-hatched duck egg that is boiled with a small amount of delicious soup inside. It is highly nutritious food and Filipinos love to eat it, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes them and gives them energy and strength. Rochelle sells about 450-600 portions every night. She and her husband sell Balut to vendors and earn 300 PHP per day.  Rochelle also rents an apartment to earn additional income which provides 2,000 PHP each month. 

Rochelle is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy duck eggs, baskets, and crackers. She will also use her loan for maintenance on her apartment. Rochelle dreams of having a market stall in the future, but for now, she and her partner will continue to lean on each other to expand their business for the sake of their children’s future. She attends weekly fellowship meetings* that inspire her to go on with life no matter what the obstacles because she has a big God who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs, baskets, and crackers

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has had her business for over 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and has now requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as shampoo, soap, noodles, coffee and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as shampoo, soap, noodles, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Edick

texts.en:
Edick, 28 years old and recently married to Chola, lives with her in Lusaka where they run a business of Mobile Mobile money transfers. Their enterprise involves the sending and receiving of money from one place to another, and they are doing well.

Edick and Chola have applied for a loan to enable them to grow their business by adding more working capital to it. This enterprise is their only source of income, and they have high hopes of opening more Mobile money transfer shops. They thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To grow their Mobile money transfers business by adding more working capital

loans.name: Lucy
