texts.en: This is Lucy. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy more packets of milk. She aspires to start another business selling charcoal. With this loan of KES 50,000, she will buy ten sacks of charcoal. Her earnings after the previous loan were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as noddles, sugar, coffee, soap and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as noddles, sugar, coffee, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has six children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees. 

She has a business of selling milk and bread. She has been in this business for two years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works from her home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. 

She has applied for loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bread and milk. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more loaves of bread and milk.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of seven grown children from Jagna, Bohol. 

Eugenia has been engaged in a vegetable selling business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. Eugenia is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Eugenia believes that this loan could help her improve her business and also her income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pennina

texts.en:
Pennina is a 39-year-old lady from Migori, in the western part of Kenya. She and her husband support eight people in their family. She has four children who are; 18, 15, 12 and eight years old respectively.
She has a small pharmacy, a business she has had for about seven years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more of medicines to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.
She has a dream of making her business more stable to enable her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is 20 years old. He lives in the small village of Samtredia District with his 17-year-old wife and an infant daughter. 

Beka requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of the family's low income and poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where 100 nut trees and mandarin trees are grown and they sell approximately 300 to 350 kg. of nuts and 150 kg. of mandarin seasonally. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Beka requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Beka will purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a milking cow, Beka’s wife will produce dairy products and the family will get an additional source of income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. 

She engages in a fishing business. She has been in this business for 15 years now, together with her husband. She also sells dried fish. This is the source of her income. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy fish net, lead sinkers and nylon string. These materials are used in fishing. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the materials that she needs. In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, lead sinkers and nylon string.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed in her tailoring business and she was able to generate more income. Aside from her tailoring business, she also sells frozen foods and herbal products. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy more herbal products and frozen foods. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will have their own business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread and other materials as well as herbal products and frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a divorced woman with seven children between 20 and 40 years of age. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Violet operates a fruit-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. 

Her greatest monthly challenges are competition and the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of bananas, mangoes, and avocados for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bananas, mangoes, and avocados for resale.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 54 years old, married, and has six children. 

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Consolacion has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Consolacion is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, and sugar and green groceries. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
This is Flocerfida. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store thus generating more income. She has had this business for ten years now. Aside from her variety store, she also generates income from her apartment. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Flocerfida dreams that her business will get bigger and that she will be able to add more products to her store like rice. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her life and business every week, when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed to add to the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is a 36-year-old married man from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. He is a father of 4 children. The oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 3. Rey is engaged in the manufacturing of hollow blocks. He has been making hollow blocks for 5 years. Aside from manufacturing hollow blocks, he also engages in fishing. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more cement, clay, iron ore and coal. In the future, Rey would like to expand his business in order to support his family and also to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more cement, clay. iron ore  and coal for the manufacturing of hollow blocks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.
Josephine has operated a cyber café offering internet services and photocopying for the last 2 years. With the KES 20,000 she wants to install fiber optic internet cables in the building. She dreams of expanding and outsourcing new machines for her business in the near future.

loans.use: to install fiber optics internet cables at her business.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa sells fruits and coconuts. She is always struggling to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Jumwa appreciates the last Kiva loan which helped her to boost her business. She again comes to you for another loan of KES 20,000 to buy more sacks of fruits and coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of fruits and coconuts.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell, ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Flordeliza is requesting to borrow PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Flordeliza successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он - Алимахмад из Таджикистана, которому 26 лет. Он женат на прекрасную женщину, которую зовут Сайсоро и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 1 года. Более 3 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  8000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и топлива. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: He has difficult life circumstances and a low income, but a kind heart and a good temperament. He is Alimahmad, a 26-year-old man from Tajikistan. He is married to a wonderful woman named Saisoro, and they have 1 child who is 1 year old. For the last 3 years, Alimahmad has been growing such crops as potatoes, wheat, carrots, and so on. He sells his harvest at the market, where his produce is in demand due to its high quality. His wife helps him to run the business. With the aim of providing his family with all their necessities, he wants to develop his business, but to do so, he needs to increase his harvest. Alimahmad is seeking a loan of 8,000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to improve his standard of living. He needs, and is waiting for, your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fuel and mineral fertilizers for his land where he grows wheat, potatoes, and carrots

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa, a 56-year-old resident of Taguig City in the Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a driver, and a mother to their children. Nimfa together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Nimfa operates a room rental business. They are rented on a monthly basis. She also sells ready-to-wear products as another source of income. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan for the repair and maintenance of the room she rents. She will also use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products.
Nimfa dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her apartment as well as buying different ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buying and selling rice grains business.

Merly has been in this business for 21 years. Merly earns additional income from a general store and a rice farm.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy and sell rice grains business, her general store and her rice farm.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Febronia

texts.en:
Febronia is a married woman with one child aged eight years. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Febronia is requesting for Kshs 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Juditha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Juditha is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like sardines, cooking oil, seasoning and other miscellaneous items for her general store business.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, cooking oil, seasoning and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jaba

texts.en:
Jaba is 46 years old. He lives in Zestaponi district with his 43-year-old wife, two sons and retired mother. Jaba has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time due to his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Jaba is a tinsmith worker. He fixes damaged cars (repairing the car body) on private orders and earns a small monthly salary. His family also has a milk cow and owns a vineyard. They use the cow for milk to make cheese. With the harvested grapes, Jaba makes vodka, which is sold together with the cheese locally at the markets. 

Jaba has requested a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Jaba will purchase an old damaged car. He already has some savings and needs this loan to add to the amount that he has. After buying a damaged car he will fix it himself and then sell it at a higher price. As he is already experienced in this field Jaba hopes he will earn a good profit to reinvest in the same business and buy more cars. This will significantly increase the family income and he will be able to provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to purchase an old damaged car, fix it and sell it at a higher price.

loans.name: Mario Norberto

texts.es: Mario tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el municipio de Ilama, Santa Bárbara junto a su hijo. Mario siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, hace 15 años que comenzó con los cultivos de café. La zona donde vive es apta para este tipo de producción. El café lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local.  El prestamo anterior lo invirtio en el mantenimiento de la finca. actulamente esta solicitando el segundo para la compra de fertilizante y seguir asistiendo sus cultivos con el fin de mejorar su finca e incrementar la producción. Su meta es seguir creciendo y mejorando los cultivos para darle un bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario, 32, is single, living in the town of Ilama in Santa Bárbara with his son. Mario has always worked in agriculture and started growing coffee 15 years ago. The zone he lives in is apt for this type of crop. He sells the coffee in the damp parchment stage at the local market. 

He used the previous loan for maintenance on his farm.  He is currently requesting the second to buy fertilizer and to continue to help his crops in order to improve his farm and increase production.

His goal is to continue growing and improving his crops in order to provide for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 32 years of age, married and with one kid who attends school, which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Patricia has operated a restaurant and pub business from home for the past four years, selling to passers-by and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as the main challenges to her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods such as wheat flour, rice and drinks for her restaurant business. Her dream is to see her child get better education and become an important person in society.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods such as wheat flour, rice and drinks for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Narcisa works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy more grocery items to sell like rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, biscuits, cooking seasonings and other items. With this loan, Narcisa will be able to improve her store and her sales. In the future, Narcisa hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more grocery to sell like rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, biscuits, cooking seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a married woman and blessed with three children aged between 9 and 26 years old. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Martina operate a tailoring business, making women’s and gents' suits for sale at home. She cites delayed payments and stiff competition from other tailors to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth, materials, and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Saymurod

texts.ru: Саймурод умный и трудолюбивый человек. Ему 22 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Еще у Саймурода есть старший брат, с помощью которого он начал свой бизнес 2 года назад купле продажей хозяйственных товаров. Он имеет свой магазин в центре города. Каждый день он встает рано утром и ходит на работу с ранним утром целью того, что текущий день будет благополучным, и его магазин будет посещать много народа. Иногда он продает много товара, а иногда нет. Так как его магазин находится в центре города, так и конкуренция очень большая. Саймурод должен расширить свой ассортимент и таким образом привлечь много клиентов. Однако, его магазин маленький и не хватает мест. Он обратился за займом с целью того, чтобы купить помещение, которое находится рядом с его магазином. Таким образом, он расширит свой бизнес и увеличит доход. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки помещения для расширения своего магазина. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saymurod is an intelligent and hard-working man. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has an older brother with whose help he started his own retail business 2 years ago. He has his own shop in the city center where he sells household goods. Every day he gets up at dawn and goes to work in the early morning with the goal of making the day a successful one and having a lot of customers come to his store. Sometimes he makes a lot of sales, and sometimes he doesn't. Because his shop is downtown, he has a lot of competition. He has to expand the range of goods he sells in order to attract more customers. However, his store is small and there is not enough room. Saymurod is seeking a loan to buy the premises that are next to his shop so he can expand his business and increase his income. He is asking for 3,000 US dollars for that purpose. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy premises to expand his shop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married. Gina works very hard to provide for her family.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, snack foods, noodles and other groceries for her general store.

Gina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, snack foods, noodles and other groceries for her general store

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure and her general store. Julie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell for her clothing sales business.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer Alfredo

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, junto a su esposa e hijo. Wilmer estableció su propio taller de fabricación de muebles para el hogar como ser: puertas, ventanas, muebles de comedor, divisiones, muebles de cocina etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace 20 años y tiene buena demanda ya que él es una persona responsable con sus trabajos y los clientes están satisfechos. Con el préstamo que solicita va comprar materiales que utiliza en su negocio como ser: maderas,clavos,etc. con esta inversión va incrementar el flujo de trabajos y también sus ingresos. Su meta es tener un taller más grande y que sea reconocido por la calidad de trabajos que realiza y darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Wilmer is 39 years old, is married and he lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, together with his wife and son. Wilmer started his own business manufacturing home furniture such as: doors, windows, dining room furniture, divisions, kitchen furniture, etc. He has maintained this business in his home for 20 years and he is in high demand because he is responsible and his clients are satisfied with his work. With the loan he is is seeking he will buy the materials that he uses in his business, such as: wood, nails, etc. With this investment he will increase the flow of business and also his revenues. His goal is to have a larger workshop, to be recognized for the quality of the work that he creates and to provide a good quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, etc. to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Silviana

texts.en: Silviana is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, eggs, ABC Mocca, envelopes, biscuits and other items.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $60. Silviana is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy  noodles, cigarettes, eggs, ABC Mocca, envelopes, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman and has been blessed with three children. Together with her husband who is a driver, she owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over a year, she has operated a cyber café business, offering computer classes, operating in town; neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She dreams of expanding and accommodating more customers in the future.  

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to pay for school for her daughter and part of it will go for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay for school for her daughter

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma 46, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Hussain, a taxi driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Thelma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Thelma dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for agriculture business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 38 years old, married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like coffee, canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

Leah has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Leah aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like coffee, canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 45 years old and married with six children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, coffee, sugar and eggs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, coffee, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en: Ruby Ann, 23 years old, is married and blessed with one child. She has managed a piggery business for almost one year. She earns an income of Php 8,000 for every hog that she sells. She would like to borrow a loan amounting to Php 25,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to utilize her loan to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La Señora Maricela tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en compañía de sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Villanueva,Cortes. Inicio su negocio de venta de alimentos y mercadería en general hace 4 años, ella vende granos básicos, café, azúcar, productos de aseo y limpieza, medicinas para enfermedades comunes. Actualmente ha solicitado su tercer  préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, carnes, medicinas, lacteos etc. Doña Maricela manifiesta que tomo el préstamo para capitalizarse y mejorar las ventas, lo cual repercutirá en el aumento de sus ganancias que destinara para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y mejoría en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricela is 29 years old and a single mother. She lives with her three children in the city of Villanueva, Cortes. She started her business selling groceries and general merchandise four years ago. She sells basic grains, coffee, sugar, cleaning supplies and medicines for common diseases. 

Currently she has requested her third loan for the sum of L10,000, which she will invest in food items such as rice, beans, butter, meat, medicine, dairy products, etc. Doña Maricela states that she is taking the loan to have capital and improve sales, which will lead to an increase in earnings destined to support her children in their education and would improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, beans, butter, meat, medicine, dairy items, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Kathia Danelia

texts.es: La señora Kathia habita en la comarca Los Rios del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e  hija su mayor sueño es terminar su casa y darle las mejores condicones a su hogar sabre todo a su hija, ella es comerciante vende fretas y verduras, su esposa trabaja como conductor de una mato taxi que es propia de el, entre los dos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar, con este Financiamiento comprara Materiales como: Arena, Bloques, Cemento etc. Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic en Conjunto a Fondos Kiva le  han brindado.
texts.en:
Kathia lives in the Los Rios región in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and daughter. Her greatest dream is to finish her home and more than anything provide the best home conditions to her daughter.

She is a merchant. She sells fruits and vegetables. Her husband works as the driver of a motorcycle taxi, which is his own. Between the two, they help each other with the home expenses.

With this loan, she will buy materials such as sand, blocks, cement, etc. She is thankful for the support that Afodenic, along with Kiva funds, have provided to her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Myla Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Myla Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a business in the Philippines buying and reselling rice, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Myla Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Myla Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en: Mbodze is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 20,000 to boost her livestock business. With the loan, she wants to  purchase four goats for fattening and later reselling at a higher price. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase four goats to fatten for resale.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For the past six years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She is asking for a loan of Kshs 30000 that she will use to buy more dry fish for sale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to be a wholesale supplier in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary operates a retail shop business, selling from home to local villages. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and tea leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines buying and selling rice. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business. Nora has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nelson Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Nelson hombre trabajador, su mayor sueño es tener su casa terminada y darle mejores condicones de vida a su esposa e hijos, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe el es Ingeniero de profesion su esposa, trabaja por cuenta propia y le apoya en todas las decisiones, con este credito que se le ha otorgado compraran: Bloques, Arena, cemente ya que quiere terminar de construir una pared para dale mejor seguridad a su vivienda, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en: Nelson is a hard worker. His biggest dream is to complete his home and to provide better living conditions to his wife and children. He lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He is an engineer by profession. His wife is self employed and she supports him in all of the decisions they make. With this authorized loan they will buy bricks, sand and cement because they want to complete the construction of a wall to better secure their home. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have given him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is a 52-year-old farmer from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. He is a married man and has two grown-up children. Raymundo needs a loan for his farm. He is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm . With this, Raymundo can produce more crops and vegetables which he can then sell at the market. 

In the future, Raymundo has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman; she has three kids who attend school. Her husband is a businessman and together they live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Rose has operated a laundry, a clothes washing business, for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a washing machine in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase washing detergents and iron boxes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents and iron boxes for her business.

loans.name: Rezzy Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rezzy Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling hollow blocks.  Rezzy Mae is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her food vending business.

Rezzy Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky is a 33-year-old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He is engaged in motorcycle transport services. He transports customers from one place to remote areas. He is paid a certain fee corresponding to the location where the customers are being transported. He has been in motorcycle transport services for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy paint and for maintaining the motorcycle like changing the oil. In the future, Ricky would like to expand his business to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy paint and pay for maintaining his motorcycle

loans.name: Celia Argentina

texts.es: La señora Celia Argentina, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, mujer luchadora, madre soltera, ella labora como estilista profesional adomicilio, en la actualidad necesita relaizar una mejoras en su hogar ya que muy pronto estaremos en tiempos lluviosos y el tejado de su hogar esta en mal estado. con  este refinanciamiento comprara: Perlines, Zinc, Hierro, Bloques, Cemento. con esto su casa estara mayormente protejida  y tendra mayor seguridad, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia Argentina is a hardworking woman that lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother who works as a visiting stylist and needs to make some home improvements, now that the rainy season is coming and her roof is in bad shape.

With this loan, Celia Argentina will buy beams, zinc sheets, iron bars, bricks and cement. This improvement will help her to protect her property and feel safer. She appreciates the support that AFODENIC and Kiva Funds have given her throughout these years.

loans.use: to buy building materials to fix her roof.

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru: Шерали добрый веселый и честный человек. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена работает на фермерском хозяйстве. Кроме жены и 5 детей, вмести с ним, живут его мать и младший брат. Шерали является основным кормильцем в семье. Более 3 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как лук, хлопок и пшеница. Он работает усердно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Он любит каждую частичку своей посеянной земли и обращается очень внимательно. Он потратил все свои деньги для проведения зимы, и данное время остался без денег. Он должен сделать новый посев, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Sheraly is a kind, cheerful and honest person. He is 35 yesars old, married, and is riasing 5 children. His wife works on a farm. His mother and older brother also live together with him, his wife, and his children. Sheraly is the main provider for the family. For more than 3 years he has been growing crops, such as onions, cotton, and wheat. He works diligently from early in the morning until late in the evening. He loves every little section of the land that he farms and looks after it very attentively. He spent everything he had on making it through the winter, and now has no money left. He needs to plant a new crop but cannot afford to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He requests a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to buy seeds and mineral fertilzer. He awaits your kind assistance and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for a land where he grows wheat, cotton

loans.name: Mehmonaly

texts.ru: Мехмонали 55 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Джамиляхон. Он имеет 4 детей. Двое из детей совершеннолетние, а двое еще не совершеннолетние. Мехмонали более 19 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как пшеница, лук и зерновые культуры. Он имеет большой опыт и делится своим опытом друзьями и новыми бизнесменами, которые хотят начать свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Он является очень хорошим агро- консультантом.  Мехмонали собирается сделать посев больше чем раньше. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки семена, минерального удобрения, а также оплатить за услугу трактора. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает, как порядочный человек оплатить займ во время. Этот займ поможет ему развевать бизнес и таким образом увеличить доход.
texts.en: Mehmonaly is 55, and is married to a wonderful woman named Jamilyahon. He has two childnre; two are grown up, and two are still teenagers. Mehmonaly has been farming for more than 19 years, raising wheat, onions, and cereal crops. He is a very experienced farmer and shares it with friends and aspiring businesspeople who want to start a farming business. In essence, he has become a very good agro-consultant. Mehmonaly intends to plant more crops than he has before He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to buy seed, mineral fertilizer, and to pay for the service of a tractor. He awaits your kind assistance and promises, as a decent person, to pay back the loan on time. This loan will help him to expand his business, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay for service of a tractor

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 28 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz; ella aprendió desde muy niña esta actividad ya que era la única actividad productiva que realizaba su familia. Por sus escasos recursos económicos, no pudo asistir a la escuela solo trabajar para obtener los ingresos económicos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cinco sacos de fertilizantes, semilla, entre otros insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con el préstamo, podrá realizar su cultivo a tiempo y con los insumos necesarios para que su cosecha sea abundante. Su mayor sueño es que sus tres hijos puedan estudiar y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Flor, 28, lives with her partner and has three children. She has been working in agriculture for ten years; she learned to grow corn from her family when she was a small girl, since this was the only activity they worked with. Because of their lack of resources, Flor could not study; she had to work in order to make a living.

Flor is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy five bags of fertilizer, seeds and other supplies to sow corn in a 7,000 square meters field. With the loan, she will be able to harvest on time and will have the supplies she needs to have an abundant harvest. Her biggest dream is to give her three children access to higher education.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizers, seeds and other supplies needed to grow corn in a 7,000 square meters field.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman; she has four kids aged between 14 to 24 years. All her children attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rebecca operates a business where she sells cereal. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. In addition, she is also a farmer which earns her other source of income. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she intends to purchase sacks of beans, maize, and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $300. She earns a good income from her business.

Georgina will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, eggs, ABC Mocca (coffee), envelopes, biscuits and other goods. 

She is a very hardworking woman and doing business very well. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, eggs, ABC Mocca (coffee), envelopes, biscuits and other goods.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a loan of 15.000 loan Philippine pesos from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy a sewing machine, needles, clothes and other materials for her tailoring business.

In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, clothes and other materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 47 years old, married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marianita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Marianita has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Roy, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children who are going to school. She has been running a butcher business since 1990.  She works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Roy's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a better meat cutter, increase her meat stock, repair the shop door, paint and put up wall tiles and buy most of the things that are needed to make cutting meat easier. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  

Roy has used her profits to pay school fees and rent on her house and shop and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more meat and sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land.
 
Roy will share this loan with her loan group, Mikoroshini, whose 14 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat and sell to more people.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

Bridget has a beauty salon, and has been in this business for ten years. She works from her home seven days out of every week. Her business challenges include seasonality, and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and hair oils.   

Bridget aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon, and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and hair oils.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar is 26 years old and single. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Edmar owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living; he has been in this business for over 3 years, and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a widow and a mother of four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For six years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to restaurant operators and neighbors. She dreams of buying land and doing farming in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more sacks of maize, rice and beans, and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize, rice and beans, and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children. Susana has been engaged in vegetable farming for more than 20 years, together with her husband. This is their source of living.

Susana is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to grow and harvest good quality vegetables.

In the future, Susana has hopes of expanding their vegetable farm and saving money for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 63 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to start another business of selling fresh water. With the loan, she wants to start a water-selling business, purchase water tanks and install water pipes. She is grateful for Kiva lenders and Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: to start a water-selling business, purchase water tanks and install water pipes.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is married and has eight children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past year, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She has joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a vegetable farmer from Jagna, Bohol. She is a married woman with six children. 

Together with her husband, Adela has been in the vegetable farming business for more than 20 years.

Adela is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and straw for her trellis. With this, she will be able to grow and produce additional harvest from the farm. 

In the future, Adela hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and straw for her trellis.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalinda is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosalinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $250. Adelina is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Banard is a commercial farmer, living in the Likoni area of Coats province, Kenya. He is single and has been in the business for over one year. He plants maize.
 
Benard was introduced to Milango by his friends, and is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to cultivate the land, and buy seeds and fertilizer. He believes this will increase his income and prepare him for a higher level of farming, as well as to provide food security in the coming seasons. 

The area has seen an increase in bee farmers, and he is would not hesitate to invest in that business.

loans.use: To cultivate the farmland, and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario, a 35-year-old married mother of five, earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She earns an additional income from raising livestock. Rosario, who has been farming for 17 years, is borrowing PHP 12000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Guard Barranco Group

texts.es: Las socias son microempresarias emprendedoras formado por tres socias una de ellas es Sonia mujer acompañada, con 38 años de edad, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es el destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales desde hace cinco años. le paga a un trabajador que es el que destaza el cerdo, de estar en la institución tiene 4 años consecutivos. El crédito lo invertirá para la compra de cerdo en pie y materia prima para hacer nacatamales como hojas de chagüites, arroz, vegetales, perecederos, mecates, maíz, chiltoma, cebolla etc. Sandra tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Blanca tiene 33 años y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The three members are enterprising micro-entrepreneurs.  One of them is Sonia, 38.  She's married and has two minor children.  For five years her business has been butchering pigs and selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales].  She pays a worker to butcher the pigs.  She has been with the institution for four consecutive years.

She's going to invest the loan in buying pigs and ingredients for nacatamales such as banana leaves, rice, vegetables, perishables, string, corn, pepper, onion, etc.

Sandra, 41, sells new clothing and Blanca, 33, has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy pigs and ingredients for nacatamales

loans.name: Sultonmurod

texts.ru: Султонмурод добрый и целеустремленный человек. Ему 55 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Жена Султонмурода домохозяйка и поэтому он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Султонмурод более 5 лет работает в средней школе учителем таджикского языка и литературы. Султонмурод хочет, чтобы его дети были тоже образованными людьми. Его старший сын учится в университете, то есть он является студентом 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета. Он учится хорошо и отлично. Султонмурод должен оплатить за учебный договор сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для оплаты учебы сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sultonmurod is a kind and goal-oriented person. He is 55 years old. He is married and has two dependent children. Sultonmurod’s wife is a homemaker, and thus he is the sole breadwinner. For over five years, Sultonmurod has been working as a secondary school teacher of Tajik language and literature. Sultonmurod would like his children to get an education as well. His eldest son studies at the university; he is a second-year student at the Tajik State University. He is getting high grades. Sultonmurod needs to pay his son’s tuition but lacks the funds. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 TJS to pay for his son’s studies. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition at the University.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia  tiene 24 tiene un hijito  de la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas, frazadas, plásticos  y otros artículos, ella ofrece sus productos a distintas oficinas, domicilios a crédito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Patricia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de mercadería variada como edredones por mayor ya que  esta época tiene mucha demanda y ella desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, la señora Patricia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Patricia is 24 years old. She has a two-year-old child. Her business is selling a variety of comforters, sheets, blankets, plastic items and other goods. She offers her products to different offices and homes on credit. This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution. Patricia will use this loan to buy wholesale a variety of merchandise such as comforters, since they are in high demand at this time, and she wants to stock her business. The reason that she is requesting this loan is that orders were made for her products and she did not have the necessary capital for them. Patricia faces challenges in her business, which are the competition and the high demand in this period, and she will use the profits to increase her merchandise and thus her sales.

loans.use: to buy comforters, plastic items and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Doña Emilia tiene 63 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y su hija en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Hace 4 años que doña Emilia presta el servicio de sastrería en la comunidad, ella confecciona   trajes de danzas, velos y cortinas para la casa.  Ella es muy conocida en la comunidad por su excelente trabajo que realiza. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero y es por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar telas, hilos y encajes  y todo material que necesita para su taller de costura. Teniendo telas en existencia los clientes le hacen más pedidos. Su meta es crecer en el negocio, planea comprar mas maquinaria para  confección de la ropa y mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Emilia is 63 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and daughter in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Emilia has been providing a tailoring service in the community for four years. She makes dance costumes, veils and curtains for homes. She is well known in the community for her excellant work. The loan she is requesting is her third and is for 10,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy fabrics, thread and lace and all the materials necessary for her sewing workshop. Having fabrics on hand, the customers make more orders. Her goal is to grow her business. She plans to buy more machinery for making clothes and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and lace to make clothing for sale.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over six years, Rida has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Rida dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Getsemani Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha de 43 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos, tiene 8 años de ser clientes de la institución su negocio es la venta de calzado de diferentes estilos y formas este lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos gamuza artesanal, zapatos cerrados de gamuza, zapatos de cuero sintético etc. Dominga tiene 48 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio y María tiene 70 años y tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Martha, 43.  She's single and has two children.  She has been a client of the institution for eight years.  Her business is selling different styles of footwear.

She'll invest the loan in buying designer suede shoes, shoes of synthetic leather, etc.

Dominga, 48, sells food at home and María, 70, has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado tres  socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro, casada, con 49 años de edad, con dos hijos y desde hace 21 años su negocio es la fábrica y venta de artesanía en hamacas de diferentes tamaños y formas, de ser cliente de la institución de ser cliente tiene 7 años de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como manila, argolla, varillas, pelotas etc. Alma tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pan,  y Elba tiene 49 años de edad y su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Milagro, 49.  She's married and has two children.  For 21 years her business has been making and selling hammocks in different sizes and styles.  She has been a client of the institution for seven years.

She'll invest the loan in buying raw materials such as netted cord, hoops, roller bearings, ball bearings, etc.

Alma, 41, sells bread and Elba, 49, has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Rin is 53 years old and has four children. Rin has worked to feed her family by growing cassava for seven years. She earns about 4000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rin’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and fully paid back the previous loans. Those loans helped her to support her business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Rin is going to use her portion of the loan to plow the cassava field and pay labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yield in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To plow her cassava field and pay labor fees

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 41-year-old vegetable farmer from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married and has four children. Vegetable farming is the main source of their living. She works with her husband in their farm, and they grow various kinds of vegetables like beans, eggplant, squash, and onions, among others.

She has plans of expanding her farm, but lacks the financial resources to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan worth PHP 6,000, which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides, and nylon for trellises. Lucita is optimistic that she can improve her business through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides and nylon for trellises

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, 49, lives in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She has five children, in total. One of them is staying with the family and still in school. Pheap and her husband are farmers, who have been growing cassava and rubber trees for twenty years to make a living. They can earn about 70,000 KHR each. 

Pheap’s group is comprised of three members who have been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. Pheap completely paid back the loan, which helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. Pheap hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava and rubber healthily and also hopes to increase her crop yield, to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is grateful for the progress that her business has witnessed over the last few months. Her business is on the rise but she currently has a limited stock and is intending to add stock. She is therefore asking for a loan of 32,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products e.g sugar, salt flour etc.

She looks forward to increased income which will enable her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of retail products e.g sugar, salt flour etc.

loans.name: Egga

texts.en:
Egga is from Kisauni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is the single mother of three children and has been the owner of a beauty salon for more than five years. 

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts, she has been able to accomplish this. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her children.

Egga is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Alphonsine is 30 years old. She is married with two children aged between four and five. Alphonsine is a group leader of Abahuje meaning “we are together” and the group members do different types of business. Some own retail and/or general stores. Alphonsine, as the president of the group, sells food. She wants to upgrade her business with the loan by adding more food in the store such as rice, sugar, beans as well salt and soaps for sale. With the profits from the business, she will be able to increase her savings and provide food for her family. Alphonsine is pictured raising her hand to so that she may be identified within the group as a leader.

loans.use: To buy more food such as rice, beans and other items to sell

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 25 year old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and two children. Both of her children are studying in school. Her husband has been successfully operating a tailoring business for three years.

Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of the loan is so that her husband can expand his business. There are currently two workers in her husband’s tailoring business. He wants to hire two more workers so that his production capacity will increase. For that purpose he requires two more new sewing machines and this loan would be used to purchase those new sewing machines.

Sidra is very hopeful that after getting this loan, her husband’s business would flourish. She is currently living in a rented house and desires to have her own house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Raul tiene 35 años y se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Raul va a usar este préstamo para la compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Raul enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantener a su familia, el Sr. Raul es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Raul is 35 years old and is a fisherman. He lives on an island in lake Titicaca, a tourist center in the department of La Paz where handicrafts made of cattails and wool are offered to the public. The majority of the island's inhabitants are engaged in fishing or tourism. This loan is his first loan cycle with the institution. Raul is going to use the loan to buy nets to use for fishing. His reason for requesting the loan is to increase his catch and increase his working capital. Raul faces challenges in his business like increasing production and is going to use the profits in continuing to improve in his work, since this is his only source of income for supporting his family. Raul is a hard-working person. He feels happy for the opportunities provided him.

loans.use: to buy nets to use for fishing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from raising livestock and selling bananas.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pump boat. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to school, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pump boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a merchant, who makes a living by fishing, and by buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than five years, so she already has some good experience. Mariam has her own boat, nets and fishing equipment, which helps her work without depending on anyone. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, so that she will have more fish in stock. Demand is high, and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mariam is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Magereza Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late twenties, is married and has one son. He is still going to school.  Amina has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and selling tap water, for two years.  She works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Amina has been selling charcoal, selling tap water, and now she will use this loan to start a grocery business. Her dream is to one day be able to have a good business.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Magereza, with 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a grocery business

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven is 51 years old and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and only son. He hasn't any profession and graduated only from secondary school, but as he confessed, he has regrets about that. Now he works as a driver in one of the enterprises in Vanadzor city. He works very hard, day and night, to meet his family's needs. In this activity, he has been engaged more than 15 years. 

His son now studies in Armenian State University of Economics in the Department of Marketing and Business Organization. Zaven is now seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to pay his son’s tuition fee. He dreams about his son becoming a good specialist.

loans.use: To pay his son’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in Kisauni, Mombasa. She has a very good work project in which she buys and sells chickens. She sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; thanks to the quality of her product, she is making headway.

Tabu struggles to get ahead and help her family through her work. Her goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava in the area to make a living. She and her husband have been in this business for twenty-five years, and they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day, but Nary can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.  

This is the second microloan for Nary with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Nary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her rice and cassava planting, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Yoshimar Jeanneth

texts.es: Yoshimar  es una joven de 26 años, es mamá de una niña de  3 años y aunque el papá de su hija le ayuda con algunos gastos de la niña, ella es la que se encarga de la crianza de la misma. Se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo a familiares, amistades, tiendas y oficinas. Vive en casa de sus papas,  los cuales le ayudan con el cuidado de la niña cuando ella tiene que salir a hacer sus ventas y cobranzas, estas ventas  le generan el ingreso con el que ella y su hija pueden vivir con una economía casi estable.
