El papá de la  niña no vive con ella, ya que tiene otra pareja, sin embargo le da un monto de dinero mensual para que pueda suplir de alguna manera su ausencia. Este monto de dinero no alcanza para el total de gastos que se tiene con la niña, es por esta razón que Yoshimar quiere incrementar sus ventas colocando en la puerta del garaje de la casa de sus papas un mostrador donde pueda exponer sus cosméticos de forma diaria. El crédito será destinado a la compra de este mostrador con el cual podrá generar mayores ingresos y además estabilidad en su negocio, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida de ella y de su hija.
texts.en:
Yoshimar is a young woman who is 26 years of age. She is the mother of a three-year-old daughter. The father of her daughter helps with some of the child’s expenses, but she is in charge of raising her. Yoshimar sells cosmetics through catalogs to her relatives, friends, as well as to stores and offices. She lives at the house of her parents, who help care for her daughter when she is out making sales or collecting payments. Her sales generate income by which she and her daughter can live in an almost financially stable situation.

The father of her daughter does not live with her, but she already has another partner. He gives her a monthly amount that somewhat helps to compensate for the absence of the child’s father. However, this amount does not cover all of her daughter’s expenses. For this reason, Yoshimar wants to increase her sales by setting up shop in the garage of her parents’ house. She will install a counter where she can display her cosmetics on a daily basis.

The loan will be used to buy a display counter so that she can generate more income and create more stability for her business. As a result, Yoshimar can improve the quality of life for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a display counter for her business.

loans.name: Saha

texts.en:
Saha is a married woman and lives at her own home. She is engaged in sales in her cosmetics shop. She has her own premises and has a good amount of customers, and thus she has a good monthly income.

Saha is a hardworking person. She hopes to get ahead, and her wish is to enlarge her business and therefore be able to meet more customers’ needs.

The purpose of the loan is to buy more merchandise and meet the needs of her clients. Saha wants to increase her daily sales and gain customer loyalty.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and meet the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is 22 years old and a responsible mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband, in a rented house. Her husband has been running a garment shop for three years, and this is the only source of income for her family. Her household expenses are very large compared to the business income, because of which she is facing a lot of financial problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount her husband would buy a variety of new dresses, shirts, jeans, and suits, to attract more customers. His sales would be increased in this way, and his monthly income and savings would also be increased. With the profit amount Mafia would purchase her own house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: to provide her husband with the means to increase his shop's inventory with new clothing, in greater variety

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs and cheese that will help her to invest back into her business and boost her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia  tiene 39 años tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 8, 5 y 19 años, se dedica  a la venta de variedad de artículos, le va muy bien con esta actividad, este préstamo es el primero que tiene dentro de la institución, La Sra. Patricia  vive en la localidad de Tiquipaya donde escasea los servicios básicos y también el agua la mayor parte del tiempo se compra agua de las cisternas que ofrecen agua por cada zona a un precio módico, por este motivo el solicito este préstamo para la construcción de un baño con  un tanque de agua para poder tener reserva de agua ya que una de las principales acciones para la construcción de un Tanque de agua es para almacenar y distribuir el agua, construcción de cañerías que lleva el agua hasta las distintas dependencia como el baño, ducha y cocina y esto es de mucha utilidad ya que las cisternas van una vez a la semana y muchas veces su familia se queda sin agua y este liquido elemento es imprescindible en cada hogar y con la construcción de este baño  la Sra. Patricia  mejorara de gran manera su calidad de vida, por este motivo se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Patricia is 39 years old. She has three children who are 8, 5 and 19 years old. She sells a variety of products. This business is going well for her. This loan is her first with the institution. Patricia lives in the locality of Tiquipaya where basic services and water are scarce. The majority of the time, water is bought from the water wagons that offer water in each area for a modest price. Therefore, she is requesting this loan to construct a bathroom with a water tank, in order to be able to have a water reserve, since one of the principal reasons for the construction of a water tank is to store and distribute the water along with the construction of water pipes that lead to the bathroom, shower and kitchen. This is of great utility, since the water wagons come by once a week and her family is often without water and this basic element is essential in every home. With the construction of this bath, Patricia will greatly improve their quality of life, which is why she is grateful for this opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy an eco-friendly bathroom.

loans.name: Gaspher

texts.en:
Gaspher is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is a mason. He has been working in this the trade for the past twenty years. He is a married father of two school-going children. Owing to an increased need for money / finances, and the unreliability of income from the masonry business, Gaspher has decided to open a retail shop.

He is therefore asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings (KES). He will use the loan to buy retail stock, for example, sugar and cooking oil. He hopes to meet all the needs of his family and especially, the education.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, like sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Emigdia

texts.en:
Emigdia is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has eight children, and she is from Jagna, Bohol. Emigdia is engaged in a retailing business, selling goods like rice, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and others. This is her source of income.

Emigdia needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, sugar, vinegar and seasonings, soap and toiletries. She hopes to earn a higher income from the business, so that she can help her husband in providing for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, sugar, vinegar and seasonings, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Danixa Alexandra

texts.es:
La Sra. Danixa Vive en Orquídeas (Guayaquil), ella tiene  48 años de edad. Ella empezó con su negocio porque queria independizarce y ya no trabajar en una empresa, sino ser ella una microempresaria. Por eso comenzo a comprar utiles de oficina para vender en un local, poco a poco empezo a tener ingresos para tener su papeleria. 

En la actualidad tiene una papeleria surtida, unas cabinas telefonicas y tambien vende cosmeticos.No esta casada pero tienen un hijo menor de edad. 

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar implementos para papeleria, telefonos y cosmeticos y asi realizar sus manualidades. Ella desea para  el futuro poder comprarse una casa, ver crecer a su hijo, y seguir realizando su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Danixa is 48 years old and lives in Orquídeas (Guayaquil). She started her business because she wanted to be independent and not have to work for a company. In other words, she wanted to become a micro-entrepreneur. Danixa started out buying office supplies that she could sell at a storefront. As she gradually earned a profit, she was able to open a stationery shop.

At the moment, she has a stationery shop that is stocked and a few phone booths. She also sells cosmetics. Danixa is not married, but she has a young child.

She will use this loan to buy inventory such as stationery, telephones, and cosmetics. Danixa will also make handicrafts. In the future she wants to buy a house, see her child grow up, and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery, telephones, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Judalyn

texts.en:
Judalyn is 57years old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a mother and is married to Hugo, a watch technician. Together with her husband they manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Judalyn operates a watch-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion of their business. They offer repair and check-up of watches. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in service fees every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of watches. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Judalyn hopes to have another shop soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for watch batteries, bracelets and other materials needed in repairing a watch.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 34, lives with her three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She still has two children to take care of and they are still in school, while the other one helps the family’s business. To make a living, she has been working as a garment worker for 14 years. To increase her income, she also sells grocery items in her village. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR each day after expenses.  

Sreyneang has just joined with VisionFund this cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell. With this loan, Sreyneang hopes to increase her family’s income to make their lives better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Lolita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like sugar, bread, coffee, noodles, candies and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible items for selling.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is 43 years old and hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a janitor by profession and he has a very low monthly income. Because of this they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Raheela is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work from 25 years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would increase. Her daughter also helps her in sewing clothes. She would also purchase some threads and clothes. She would pay her installments with the profit amount and pay some household expenses. She is very hopeful that the loan will help her family.

loans.use: purchase two new sewing machines to stitch more clothes.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of two children ages nine and seven. Adeline is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Adeline is hopeful that through this loan their farming business will boom and generate more revenue necessary for their needs and for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis Alfonso, labora desde hace 38 años en el sector del calzado y desde hace ocho años decidió montar su propio negocio en su vivienda, dedicado a al reparación de zapatos. Labora diariamente en conjunto con un familiar. Actividad que se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para su familia y le ha permitido garantizarles educación a sus dos hijos. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como tintas, sintéticos, hilos, pega y mejoras locativas para la proyección de una mejor imagen.
Sueña con diseñar y producir calzado a gran escala pero es conciente que no cuenta el dinero necesario, por lo cual comenzará a ahorrar para hacer realidad su deseo.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso has worked in the shoe business for 38 years. Eight years ago, he decided to set up his own shoe repair shop at home. He works every day with the help of a relative. Luis Alfonso has now made this business a source of income for his family, which allows him to pay for the education of his two children.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as dyes, synthetics, thread, and glue. Luis Alfonso will also pay for structural improvements so that his shop will have a better appearance. He dreams of designing and producing shoes on a large scale, but he is aware that he does not have the necessary funds. For this reason, he will start saving so that he can make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy dyes, synthetics, thread, glue and to pay for structural improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Khmanh's Group

texts.en:
Khmanh is 35 years old, and she lives with her husband and five daughters in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district. Rice farming and cassava growing are the main sources of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 13 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 18,000 KHR, and she is able to save 8,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Khmanh with VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loan. She is now leading her group of four, to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for having her field plowed. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business, by using the fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to have her field plowed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is 50 years old and a responsible and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Her husband is working in a wood shop. He has a very low salary and it is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses. Consequently, they are facing many problems in life.

Since 2003 Khatija has been running a small general store, to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods to resell, like milk, sugar, rice, soap, creams, and washing powder, and she wants to introduce some new items for her general store. She believes that these purchases will help her to fulfill the demands of the customers and to increase her savings. She would reinvest part of the profit into the general store, and use another part of it to pay her household expenses, including the education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store, like milk, sugar, etc., including some new items to offer to her customers

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 34 años de edad esta casada con Lucio y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida  abase de adobe .Posee unos terrenos agrícolas las cuales dedica integramente a la producción de cacao orgánico, café y achiote.Realiza sus labores en unos terrenos que adquirió desde muy joven junto a su esposo donde convoca a familiares en calidad de trabajadores y realiza labores con el fin de obtener una calidad óptima para recuperar el capital invertido.
Su principal inconveniente inicial fue el de no contar con capital suficiente para la siembra de cacao en el área total de sus terrenos, motivo por el cual su crecimiento económico fue de a pocos con el paso de los años.
Desea con el tiempo adquirir un terreno adicional e iniciarse en la producción de barbasco puesto que la calidad de tierras que poseen sus terrenos garantiza una buena producción de estos productos.Este viene a ser su primer préstamo otorgado por Kiva y  agradece la confianza brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Requiere contar con S/.3,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar .
texts.en:
Angélica, 34 years old, is married to Lucio and has two children with whom she lives in a house built with a base of adobe. She owns some farming land entirely dedicated to the growing of organic cocoa, coffee, and achiote. On the land that she and her husband acquired when very young, relatives get together as good workers in order to obtain excellent quality to recover the capital invested. 

Her main disadvantage at the beginning was not having enough capital to plant cocoa on all the land, which is why her financial growth was so small as years went by.

She wants over time to buy additional land and begin to grow muellin since the quality of land she has guarantees a good harvest of this product. This becomes her first loan granted through Kiva and she appreciates the confidence offered and she is committed to making her payments on time.

She is asking for 3,000 soles to hire workers at the site.

loans.use: to hire workers for her farmland

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in Kisauni. She is married and has three children. She is the owner of a well-stocked general store which she has had for over two years. It is worth noting that she works with her whole family and it is going very well. Her husband is a driver and he contributes to the family's basic needs. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family they have been able to grow considerably. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they might offer a greater variety and comfort to their customers.

Virginia is seeking this loan for the purchase of drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products in order to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: purchase drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products.

loans.name: Kutakurana Group

texts.en: This is 47 year old Elizabeth from Murehwa, a village 75 km northeast from the capital city Harare. She is married with five children, three attending school. Elizabeth runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition from other traders. Elizabeth has requested for a loan of $300 to increase her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Elizabeth plans to operate a large supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.
